loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 41 years old and married with three children living in a rural village of Kampong Speu province’s Somrong Torng district. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice, which they have been doing for 23 years. Their current business earns about 30,000 KHR per day.

Sokha has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles already. Now she is seeking another loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and grow her current business to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter's Group is made up of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Peter, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 39 years old, married, and has one child. Peter has been a farmer for five years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Peter isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013, and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year, Peter will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Using this loan, Peter's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests.

loans.name: Sholeh

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Sholeh. Sholeh lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about a one hour drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he provides mobile payment services for his community. Sholeh joined Ruma in 2014, and this is the second time he is applying for a loan from Kiva. The previous loan helped him to process more mobile transactions on weekends, and he thanks all of the lenders because of it.  

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sholeh sees improvements in his business. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile payment service provider. 

As the business grows, he hopes to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sholeh improve his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services. 

Sholeh is the one who is standing in the photo. He will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for his community

loans.name: Sokhorm

texts.en:
Sokhorm is 30 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives in a rural village of Kampong Spue province’s Somrong Tong district. Sokhorm and her husband earn a living by planting rice, which they have been doing for 12 years. Their current business earns them about 40,000 KHR per day.

Sokhorm has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her corn successfully and increase her current business to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Spue province’s Somrong Tong district, Sophal is a 49-year-old married mother of one daughter who is still in school. She and her husband have earned a living by farming rice for ten years. Their current business earns about 25,000 KHR per day.

Sophal has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. The past loans have helped Sophal to better support her family and increase her business. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and also hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s living standard and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Maa Santosi Atmamahila Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, 8 women from the small village of Khurda district stepped out, decided to build a secure future for their families and formed a group named Maa Santosi Atmamahila Self Help Group. The members of Maa Santosi Atmamahila self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Satyabhama, who was selected as their president.

Satyabhama is 48 years old and lives with her two children. Her husband passed away six years ago. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her father, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took over the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. 

Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers and ladyfingers. She has a very good relationship with her customers as the vegetables she sells are fresh. 

Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a larger scale. For this reason, she has requested a loan. She will use the loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bhagabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Manjulata is a 48-year-old woman living with her two children, ages 24 and 22 years old. She lives in a village close to Khurda city in the Khurda district in Odisha. Manjulata got married to a fisherman when she was 20 years old. Like other village folk, her husband was a fisherman who went to a nearby lake and river for fishing. Unfortunately, Manjulata lost her husband's mental and partly physical condition in 2002 in an accident when he went fishing. Since then, she has been working hard to support her children. 

Manjulata started her business of selling fresh fish and dried fish. Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated. Dried fish has a storage life of several years. Dried fish is used in different delicacies just as fresh fish is and is very popular in the region. Manjulata buys fish directly from the local fishermen, sells some fresh, and dries some to sell as dried fish. She purchases 10 to 12 kg of fresh fish and 18-20 kg of dried fish and sells it by roaming door to door in the nearby villages. She earns 4,000 INR per month. 

Manjulata, along with her group, has applied for a loan of 135,000 INR so that she can use her portion to purchase the fish in bulk to make more dried fish and stock up during the monsoon season. There is a huge demand for dried fish during the monsoon season as not much stock is available in the market. So she can get a better price as well. 

This loan will help Manjulata to increase her working capital to run her business by increasing her revenues almost 50%, giving her 5,000 to 6,000 INR per month. She wants to save enough to give her children a good quality of life and send them to college.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk to make more dried fish and to stock up during the monsoon season for her fish business.

loans.name: Baba Sarathi Dev Shg Group

texts.en:
The responsible Baba Sarathi dev Self Help Group is made up of 12 members. The members of this group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Jyotsna, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her hand raised is Jyotsna. 

Jyotsna is a 36-year-old woman living with her husband and two children. She makes leaf plates and bowls woven out of dry leaves and sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes – mainly for serving food. Jyotsna makes different types and sizes of plates depending upon the demand of her customers. She has requested a loan to purchase machinery so she can weave the plates more frequently and quickly and to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue and plastic. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like dry leaves, thread, glue and plastic and a machine for weaving leaf plates

loans.name: Maa Ugratara Shg Group

texts.en:
The Maa Ugratara Self Help Group consists of eight members from a small village in Khurda district, Odisha, India. All the members of this group are female. They are engaged in different business activities for the elimination of poverty. Three of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them to want to struggle harder to get ahead. One person who deserves to be highlighted is Pramodini who works selling vegetables. 

Pramodini is currently facing lots of problem in terms of finances as her husband met with an accident some years ago and lost his mental situation and one hand. Through her job, Pramodini works to support her family and to improve her business. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking her part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.name: Jay Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Jayanti, the lady standing with raised hand, is a 34-year-old lady who lost her husband in 2011. Since then, she has taken on all the burdens of her family. She lives with her daughter, age 8, and her son, age 7. After her husband passed away, she became involved in an agriculture activity. This is not sufficient to manage her family, so she purchased a cow. Now she is taking care of her cow and selling milk in the local market. From this business, she earns 2,000 to 2,500 INR per month. She wants to purchase one more cow and continue her milk business. She has one year of experience in this field and she has time to take care of the cow. 

Jayanti, along with her group, requested a loan of 140,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows. She says that this business can strengthen her economic condition and she will be able to pay her children's tuition. She has a dream of educating her children so they can earn for themselves in the future. She does not want her children to face the same kinds of problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows.

loans.name: Agrati Shg Group

texts.en:
Agrati Self Help Group consists of nine women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. One of them is Jyotsnarani, who was selected as the president of this group. 

Jyotsnarani is 47 years old, divorced and staying with her three children. Two of her children are in school. She hopes to see them as successful persons in their lives. She has a few acres of land in her village and she is using her land in vegetable and paddy cultivation. Her children are supporting her in this activity. She and her group have requested a loan of 180,000 INR. Her portion will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation such as vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.name: Baba Bajarangabali Shg Group

texts.en:
Sasmita managed to establish a general store on the sidewalk. These areas lack this type of business because the majority of families eat what they produce in the fields. Sasmita is a divorced mother of two children, ages six, and nine, who mean the world to her. She works between 10 and 12 hours per day just so they have a better future by going to school and having the opportunities that she could not have due to the lack of resources. She learned the business empirically and now that she has a plan. She wants to strengthen her business. You can help increase her income so she is able to pay for her children to attend school. 

With the help of a loan, she will use her portion to buy an assortment of items, mostly products that are not produced by the land, such as cleaning supplies in general, spices, biscuits, and some grains and vegetables that are not commonly grown. This loan will help her to improve her sales and diversify the products she offers. The other member of this Baba Bajarangabali Shg are engaged in different activities to raise some extra money so that they can help their families.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her general store

loans.name: Maa Harachandi Shg Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Puri district of Odisha, Padmini is 53 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income, and she sells milk for additional income. She has one cow. She is the only person earning in her family because her husband is not able to do any work. She can earn more income by goat rearing, and for this, she has requested this loan along with her group. 

This is Padmini's first loan with Peoples Forum, and she has committed to repaying her loan on time. She leads this group of 13 members to apply for this loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to purchase more baby goats to raise and sell in the future. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Pandabasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Harapriya, about 37 years old, lives in a small village named Raj Jankia in the Khurda District of Odisha, India. The only source of income for her family was a small grocery store. Having been hit by high inflation and an unbalanced monthly income, they could hardly think of saving anything for the future. With an aim to increase her income, she planned to expand her business. Harapriya tried to get a loan from several financial institutions, but she was unable to fulfill the requirements of banks and other institutions. 

She learned about Peoples Forum and its services from a group member of another group from the same village. The only challenge for her was to motivate other villagers to form a group so that they could avail a loan. She managed to convince a few villagers to join the orientation meeting conducted by Peoples Forum. After understanding the benefits of the loan, another 11 women stepped out to form a Self Help Group named Pandabasuni Shg. All the members of this group were trained and educated about several small business models, which helped them to create a strong base for their future. They have requested this loan, which will help them to start their businesses. Harapriya will use her portion to buy sugar, edible oil, spices, cookies, etc. in bulk.

loans.use: to buy sugar, edible oil, spices, cookies, etc. in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Maa Khandeswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Sumitra is a member of the Maa Khandeswari Self-help Group in a small village in the Puri district of Odisha. She has stories to tell about how she made her living and gradually improved her lifestyle by making leaf plates. She, along with her husband, prepares leaf plates and sells them in the local market. 

The business of leaf plates began long before she got training from Peoples Forum, but the business did not flourish because of a lack of capital. It was through joining hands with Peoples Forum that her business got the much-needed push to witness progress. The family now owns a concrete house and wishes to sell their leaf plates in the main market rather than the local market. 

The production has subsequently increased, as they now have their vehicle to take the product to the market. She now does not have to worry about her children's study expenses. It is she who has started the habit of saving money in her family. Over the course of time, she now prepares leaf plates of different sizes and according to the demands of various customers. She, along with her husband, even sells these leaf plates to various sweets shops, small stalls selling eatables, etc.

Now she will use her loan portion to buy a leaf plate-making machine to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy a leaf plate-making machine to increase her production.

loans.name: Maa Parvati Mahila Shg Group

texts.en:
The members of Maa Parvati Mahila Self Help Group are all women from the Puri district in Odisha. Peoples Forum has brought in the habit of saving among the women, as the members are involved in various activities, such as agriculture, dairy, animal husbandry, poultry farming, etc. These women, with the help of their husbands, not only support their families but also set examples for other women in the village — that women can save money, run the house and become entrepreneurs. 

Minati is involved in a dairy business along with her husband, and tells the story of her initial days of business hardships. Nevertheless, her living conditions have relatively improved, as stated by her. She dreams of educating her two children and making them pursue a higher education. She hopes over the course of time, she will renovate her house and living standards. She will use her portion to buy a cow for milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk to sell

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
On 6th Dec., 2014, 10 women from the village of Tainlo in the Puri district of Odisha state came together to form a self-help group. Formation of this group was initiated by Sachala, who is also the president of this group. The group applied for a loan of 200,000 INR or 20,000 INR per member for the 10 members. Sachala currently has a dairy farm with one cow. She is milking almost eight to 10 litres of milk every day. She sells six litres to the local milk federation and the rest of the milk she keeps for her family's consumption. Sachala's husband and two children share responsibility for looking after the cow. She has kept aside some amount to take care of feeding and veterinary expenses. Knowing that she can request a second and third loan for expanding her business, she has started working twice as hard to turn her business into a profitable venture. 

With her own portion of the loan amount, Sachala will buy another cow. With her efforts, she might become the much needed source of motivation for other women in her village. She hopes to increase her milk production by adding a new cow in her dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a new cow for milk production and selling.

loans.name: Saibaba Shg Group

texts.en:
These women belong to the self help group “Saibaba SHG.” This group is located in the district of Puri, part of the state of Odisha, India. One member is Santilata. She is a divorced woman who is 42 years old and has one daughter.

Santilata alternates her daily activities with the business of selling fresh fruits, such as apples, oranges, bananas, etc., among others. Santilata has worked in this business for a while, and it is going very well thanks to her daily hard work. She wants to be able to continue working in her business in order to keep supporting her daughter's education. 

This member, along with her group, has requested a loan, and she will use her portion to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell. The other members work selling milk, selling woven goods, etc. Santilata is grateful to those who form part of this dream, and she promises to repay the loan on time and in the prescribed manner.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to resell

loans.name: Maa Trinath Shg Group

texts.en:
“The thing women have yet to learn is nobody gives you power. You just take it.”  What can be a better example than Maa Trinath SHG to prove this!! With an aim of contributing to the family income, 11 women from a village joined hands to form a group. Achyutapur is a small village located in a remote area of Khurda district, Odisha, India. The strong determination of the group members led them to overcome the social barriers and they managed to convince their family members to form the group. 

Bichitra wants to use the loan to purchase agricultural equipment, seeds and fertilizers whereas other group members have planned to expand their businesses with this loan. Bichitra is the president of this group. She is 36 years old and a mother of two children. Her husband works as a daily laborer. Bichitra and her husband both decided to work together in their agricultural field to produce paddy and maize. The members are trained in entrepreneurial skills by executives of Peoples Forum and they are committed to using the loan efficiently. The members have requested a loan of 165,000 INR to invest in their businesses, which will help them to build a strong base for a safe future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural equipment, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Satya Sai Shg Group

texts.en:
In a remote village, there is a woman who many villagers know because of her effort in life and positive attitude. Her name is Kanaklata. She is 36 and lives with her two children. Kanaklata's family is also known by the people as a very happy family, even in their difficult situation. She is facing lots of problem in her life because her husband is ill. She and her children work very hard at agricultural production, including cultivating rice and vegetables and raising chickens and fish. Besides this, she works extra for a local construction employer to earn more and provide better living conditions for the family. 

Kanaklata, along with her group, applied for a loan from People’s Forum. She will use her portion to buy small fish so that she can expand the fish breeding and increase her income to cover her family's expenditures. 

This is the first time Kanaklata is taking out a loan from People’s Forum, and she expects to have a significant change for her family, especially when she gets the training lessons from the program. In the picture, Kanaklata is standing with her hand raised.

loans.use: to buy small fish to expand her fish-breeding activity.

loans.name: Baba Sarbeswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Basanti, the lady standing with her raised hand, is a 45-year-old lady living with her husband and two children. Her husband met with an accident some years ago and lost his both arms, and from that time Basanti had to manage all the family's responsibilities. 

She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells five liters of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons. She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger. 

Basanti, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 180,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to expand her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. 

All the members of this group are engaged in the dairy business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and renovate the cattle shed

loans.name: Laxmi Narayan Shg Group

texts.en:
The group "Laxmi Narayan Self Help Group" is composed of members who are all eager to improve their families' economic situations. Harapriya, the lady standing with her raised hand, is the secretary of this group. She is a married woman of 38 years, and is in the business of selling personal-care products and ladies’ fashion items, work that she had learned from helping her husband when her husband was running this business. Now, her husband is not able to work hard, so he only supports this business by his loyal customers and relationships he had earlier. 

She will use her loan portion to invest in the purchase of more personal-care products and ladies' fashion items so that she can sell them to her customers. Other members of this group are engaged in petty businesses such as a grocery store, general store, vegetable selling, etc. All are very happy with this loan and would like to thank Kiva lenders for the credit provided to them.

loans.use: to purchase more personal-care products and ladies' fashion items.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is 25 years old and lives in Baniswef. She is divorced because she had many problems with her parents-in-law and she lives in her father's house. Marian has a son, so she started a beauty salon and wedding dress rental business to cover her son's monthly expenses. Her salon has become very well-known in her village and she wishes to expand her business, so she requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy new wedding dresses and accessories.

loans.use: To buy new wedding dresses and accessories for her dress rental business

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LCIERNAGAS” iniciará el trigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Viviana es la Secretaria Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, servicio de construcción, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Viviana es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artesanía en yeso; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de su padre, ya que desde sus varios años trabaja con este producto, es por eso que con el ahorro de un pequeño capital decidió emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de resina de yeso por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LUCIERNAGAS” communal bank will start its thirty eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Cascada center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Viviana is the secretary. The communal bank members' businesses are varied. Among them are selling blankets, a neighborhood store, selling perfume, selling sports clothing, selling salchipapas, construction services, selling toys, and selling underskirts. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Viviana. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago on the invitation of a massive promotion that the institution does in her area. Right now she has a business selling plaster hand made crafts. She says that she learned this business from her father, and has worked with this product for a long time. That is why with the savings of a little capital she decided to start an independent business. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying plaster resin wholesale from wholesalers in La Paz. After production, she will sell the items in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy plaster resin wholesale.

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROGRESO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ausberta es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de salchipapas, servicio de construcción, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ausberta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artesanía en yeso; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de su madre, ya que desde sus 10 años trabaja con este producto, es por eso que con el ahorro de un pequeño capital decidió emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muñecas de yeso por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The association A.C. “PROGRESO” will begin its' seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Cascada. This group is made up of 9 members, and is directed by a General Committee. Señora Ausberta is the Secretary of this committee. The various businesses of the members of this association include: skirt sales, a corner shop, perfume sales, sportswear sales, hot dog and french fry sales, construction service, toy sales, and underskirt sales.

This loan will benefit the group of small business owners of which Señora Ausberta is a member. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer one year ago, by way of an widespread promotional invitation in her area from the institution. Currently, she has a business selling plaster handicrafts. She makes it known that she learned this business from her mother, because she has worked with these products since she was 10 years old. For this reason, and with a small amounts of savings, she decided to launch an independent business.

The loan that Señora Ausberta is requesting is to increase her capital, to buy plaster dolls at wholesale, that she will acquire from wholesalers in La Paz, and afterwards, she will sell at the location of her business. This type of work enables her to generate income to financially support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has a son.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Ausberta responds by saying she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy plaster dolls at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her media and advertising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electronic spare parts and tools to meet the demand of his clients

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is a 38-year-old married father of three children. He works hard to develop his business to provide his children with the best education and to make sure he can respond to their increasing living needs. Misbah works in the construction business, specializing in transporting cement and many other materials from one place to another. He has fifteen years of experience in this domain, since his father had a similar business. He started his current business in 2014.

Misbah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's school tuition fees. He hopes that he can develop his business more in the future to make sure he can afford to provide them with university degrees.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. Cirila is married and has a buy and sell lumber business in the Philippines. 

Cirila has been in this business for six years now.

Cirila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell.

Cirila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, electrodes, rods, etc to optimize his inventory to make the metallic pieces that have been ordered from him.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met is 53 year old and married. She is a citizen from a rural village of Kampong Spue province’s Somrong Torng district. For the past 35 years, Met and her husband have been rice farmers and they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day.

Met is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. This will be her sixth micro-loan with the Kiva partner, VisionFund. Met hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Yaoska Elizabeth

texts.es:
Acceder a la educación superior es un privilegio cuando se vive en un país en vías de desarrollo como Nicaragua. En general, el único apoyo con él que se cuenta es el de los padres, es el caso de Yahoska.  Esta joven de 23 años,  estudia Licenciatura en enfermería, porque se siente identificada con la labor social y al momento de decidir que estudiar, valoró sus cualidades y habilidades personales. 

Yahoska cursa el último semestre de su carrera y por ello solicita le crédito para pagar los gastos de titulación. Lo cual le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá aplicar a plazas laborales y así se abrirá puertas en su carrera. También, podrá retribuir todo el esfuerzo de sus padres para con ella, ayudando a la economía familiar. Ella planea continuar estudiando para especializarse en alguna área de su carrera y adquirir a corto plazo una vivienda.
texts.en:
Access to higher education is a privilege for those who live in developing countries such as Nicaragua. Most Nicaraguan students, such as Yahoska, can rely only on the support of their parents to meet the cost of their education. Yahoska is 23 years old and is studying for a bachelor's degree in nursing because she feels drawn to social work. When deciding what field to study, Yahoska felt her personal qualities and talents were well-suited for nursing. 

Yahoska is now in the last semester of her program and is applying for a loan to cover the cost of obtaining professional credentials. The loan will thus be of great help to Yahoska as she'll be able to apply for jobs and open doors to start her career with nursing credentials. She'll also be able to contribute to her family's household expenses, effectively repaying her parents for all of their support. 

Yahoska plans to continue her studies so that she can work in specialized nursing and buy her own home before long.

loans.use: to cover the cost of professional credentials.

loans.name: Elphas's Group

texts.en:
Elphas, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District. Elphas is 50 years old, married, and has nine children.

Elphas likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013, and he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Elphas plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Elphas’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Somrong Tong district of Kampong Spue province, Savorn is 49 years old and married. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs for years. Their current business earns about 20,000 KHR per day.

This is the third micro loan for Savorn with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Noong Luong 22 Group

texts.en:
Chau is 42 years old and lives in a small village where the residents rely on agricultural production for a living. He lives with his wife and his 13-year-old daughter in a small house. Cultivating rice generates the main source of income of the family and Chau has also expanded to animal husbandry to increase earnings. 

Chau is requesting a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets and pig food. He hopes that with the support of the Program, including training and consulting, he will overcome the difficulties associated with livestock production and gain high profit from his investment. Chau dreams of a bright future for his daughter and a more abundant life for his family. In the picture, he stands at the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sokhorm

texts.en:
Sokhom is aged 33 years and married with three children. 

Sokhorm is a rice farmer who has been in this business for 15 years to make a living, and she supplements her family’s income by raising pigs. With the current business, she can earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sokhorm has been with VisionFund for two cycles, and now she is applying for another loan to buy pig feed and use some of the loan to plough the fields. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income, and she also hopes to extend her current business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 36 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a retail shop business for the past one year and earns a profit of 25,000 KES. Purity has applied for her first loan of 100,000 KES, and she will be using the loan to purchase retail goods, e.g., cooking fat, flour, and soft drinks, to sell to her customers.

She hopes that the anticipated income will help her to plow it back into her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods, e.g., cooking fat, flour, and soft drinks, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bregelia

texts.en:
Bregelia is 50 years old and has five children. Bregelia is married, and two of her children are currently in school.

Bregelia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Bregelia requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Bregelia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bregelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. Estelita is married and has a business making nipa (palm) roofing in the Philippines.

Estelita requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc., for her business.

Estelita has been in this business for 32 years now.

Estelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc., for her business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se decidió por otro crédito para continuar vendiendo en el cafetín, podrá comprar una refrigeradora para helar las bebidas y conservar mejor otros productos necesarios para seguir elaborando la venta de pupusas y meriendas, espera tener mejores recursos económicos para tener su propio local.
El préstamo anterior ha sido de mucho beneficio para María, ya que el negocio se conserva más surtido, cancelo su deuda, tiene un mejor estilo de vida familiar y todo este tiempo ha mantenido la secuencia de sus labores.
texts.en: María has decided to request another loan to continue selling her food in the cafe. This loan will let her buy a refrigerator to cool soft drinks and better preserve other items she needs to continue making and selling pupusas and other snack items. María wishes she had better economic resources to run her own food stand. Her previous loan was of great help to María; her business now houses a bigger stock of items. She repaid her debt and her family now has a better lifestyle. Throughout all this time, she has maintained all of her work.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store her soft drinks and better preserve other products necessary for her to continue making and selling pupusas and other snacks.

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, vive con su esposa, hijos y nietos, se dedica a su negocio de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde, cuenta con más de 30 años de experiencia, lo aprendió dentro de su familia y por el momento no representa dificultades en desarrollar sus actividades.
Comprará un ternero, así complementara la cantidad terneros que ya tiene en venta, espera que la venta se realice y le genere las ganancias suficientes para cubrir todos sus compromisos.
Sus proyectos son comprar yuntas de bueyes para arrendarlas a los agricultores de la zona y así mejorar sus ingresos, dar  a su familia mejor alimentación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Florentín makes a living growing staple grains and raising livestock. He lives with his wife, children, and grandchildren. He works at his business from 7 o'clock in the morning until 2 o'clock in the afternoon. He has more than 30 years experience, and he learned the business from his family. At the moment, there are no difficulties in carrying out his work.

Florentín will buy a calf, to go with the group of calves that he already has for sale. He hopes to sell it and generate sufficient profit to cover all of his financial obligations.

Florentín's plan is to buy teams of oxen to rent out to farmers in the area. In this way, he will earn more income, and provide better food and clothing for his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf, to go with the group of calves that he already has for sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito porque los ingresos de subsistencia para ella y su familia dependen de los trabajos agrícolas, más que todo al cultivar maíz y frijol, ya que una parte es para alimentar a su familia y el resto para venderlo, comprara semillas (maíz y frijol), abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, para mantener su negocio con vida.
Con el crédito anterior la cosecha fue abundante, pudo mejor sus ingresos y dar a su familia una mejor vida. Juana se separó de su esposo y está luchando sola para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Juana has decided to apply for a new loan, because the subsistence income of her and her family depends on agriculture, especially the cultivation of corn and beans. Part of the yield of her crop is used to feed her family, and the rest she sells. She will buy seeds (corn and beans), manure, herbicides, and insecticides in order to keep her business going.

With the previous loan, the harvest was abundant and she was able to earn more income and give her family a better life. Juana is separated from her husband, and is fighting by herself to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds (corn and beans), manure, herbicides, and insecticides in order to keep her business going.

loans.name: Roayda

texts.en:
Roayda is 32 years old and from Baniswef. She is married with two elementary school children. Her husband works in a bakery, and they have a small grocery store that she runs to help her husband with the family income. 

She requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a fridge, some juices, fizzy drinks, rice, sugar and oil to expand her project and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, some juices, fizzy drinks, rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Theara

texts.en:
Theara is 32 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school, while another one is too young for school. He lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been his family’s main source of income for 10 years. To supplement the income, he also buys and sells cows in his village. 

Theara has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. The past loans have helped his family with sufficient food and to better support the business. Now he is seeking another loan to buy pesticides and fertilizes for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizes for his farmland

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
This group has been with ID Ghana since the establishment of this branch. It is made up of members determined to change their living conditions. To this end, they just started their sixth loan cycle in the program. Their main business is retail (sales of fishing net, smoked fish, underwear, biscuits and toffees).

George (standing on the right in the photograph) is the group’s highlighted borrower. He is 36 years old, married, and a father of three. His business is the sale of fishing nets. He gets his supplies from the market in Accra and resells in Teshie.

With this loan, he plans to purchase more fishing net, which he will sell retail. With his profits, he intends to improve his family’s living conditions, to increase his savings, and to help pay for his children’s school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing net to sell

loans.name: Hugo Lucio

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 3 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 8 y 17 años, y su negocio es la reparación de impresoras y electrodomésticos.
Él es buen padre, activo, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘El Tejar’ caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas; cientos de comerciante se acomodan lado a lado para ofertar ropa, comida, carnes, frutas, etc., de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-15 grados centígrados y durante todo el año.
Hugo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos; las hijas estudian en la escuela y el hijo aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un casa en anticrético construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la reparación de impresoras y electrodomésticos, inició su negocio ayudando a un familiar que le enseñó el oficio, más tarde se independizo para tener su negocio propio y mantener a su familia. “la reparación es un oficio que varía de acuerdo al modelo, cada electrodoméstico me brinda experiencia para poder reparar el siguiente…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia donde pueda vivir su familia, él desea realizar la compra de materiales de reparación de electrodomésticos e impresoras, como; herramientas, pegamentos, cintas y otros, para continuar con su actividad y aumentar sus reparaciones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Hugo solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de reparación de electrodomésticos e impresoras para continuar desarrollando su actividad.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and children. He has a 3-year-old son and two daughters ages 8 and 17. Hugo works repairing household electronics and printers. He is a good father, active, dependable, responsible, and hardworking. Hugo works in an area known as "El Tejar," which is characterized by informal businesses. Hundreds of venders station themselves shoulder to shoulder to sell clothing, food, meat, fruit, etc. The region has a temperate and dry climate, with temperatures that vary between 5 and 15 degrees Celsius throughout the year. 

Hugo has dark skin, short black hair, and dark eyes. He is short and has a robust build. His native language is Aymará, which he speaks at home with his family, but he also speaks Spanish out in public and in his work. Hugo shares his life with his wife, who also works, and with his children. Hugo's daughters are in school and his youngest is not yet old enough to go to school. They live in a brick home with a roof made of corrugated iron. The home has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Hugo's business is a repair shop for printers and household electronics. He began his business by helping a relative who taught him this trade. Later, Hugo became independent and opened his own business to support his family. "This kind of work varies depending on the model of each item. Each one offers me experience for the next time I fix another one like it," he says. 

Hugo's dream is to have a house of his own, where he can live with his family. Hugo wants to buy materials to repair printers and electronics such as: tools, adhesives, tape, and other items so that he can continue his work and increase the repairs that he does. This is Hugo's first loan cycle with this lending institution in the 20 years that he has been working independently. For these reasons Hugo is requesting a loan: to buy materials to repair household electronics and printers so that he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair household electronics and printers so that he can continue working.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 39 years old and married with five children.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elisa has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and fruit vending.

Elisa aspires to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros is 57 years old now.

Milagros has a direct selling of household products business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products for her business.

Milagros has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a general store business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock like snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like snack foods, soft drinks, cereals, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, tiene un negocio en el que realiza diferentes actividades como manejar una tienda de productos de la canasta básico, ofrece el servicio de molino nixtamal, tiene ganado y cultiva granos básicos, el negocio del molino lo tiene desde hace 26 años posteriormente inicio a ofrecer otro tipo de producto a sus clientes hasta que logro establecer la tienda, la cual tiene 18 años de estar funcionando, tiene una familia conformada por su esposa e hijos, los cuales estudian nivel básico, don Luis es el único proveedor de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Invertirá en golosinas, especias, detergente, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, etc., para fortalecer la tienda y algunos repuestos para el molino, mejorara el inventario de su negocio esperando tener mayor demanda de sus productos y mejores ingresos.
Su visión es conservar su negocio estable y bien surtido para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y dar a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Luis has a business where he does different activities such as running a basic food store, offers corn milling services, has cattle and grows basic grains.. He started the mill business 26 years ago and later added other products to offer his clients until he established his store which has been functioning for 18 years.

He has a family composed of his wife and children who study at middle school. Luis is the only source of income to cover the needs of his family. He will invest in sweets, spices, detergent, oil, juices, soft drinks, etc to strengthen his store and some parts for his mill. He hopes to have greater demand for his products and greater income. His vision is to keep his business stable and well-stocked to satisfy his customers and provide his family with a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in sweets, spices, detergent, oil, juice, soft drinks, etc to strengthen his store and buy parts for his mill.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a parent of nine children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of amakan (bamboo mats) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coco lumber. Nelia is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase amakan to sell for her business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase amakan (bamboo mats) to sell

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada y junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, tiene un hijo y esta embrarazada. 

Elena, le ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de maíz y maicillo, también siembran pipían, ya que en el lugar donde viven se produce este cultivo, ademas de la agricultura, también tienen crianza de gallinas y cerdos , sus cultivos están a 1 kilómetro de su casa, tiene que caminar para llegar hasta ahí, porque no tienen medio de transporte.- Elena, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para hacer el desayuno y lleva a su niño a casa de la mamá para que se lo cuide, mientras ella sale a trabajar con su esposo hasta las 11:00 a.m. porque luego tiene que regresar a la casa y alimentar a sus animales. 

El crédito será para comprar semilla de maíz y pipian y para comprar abono para sus cultivos.

Ella sueña con terminar sus estudios para tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro y darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, ademas sueña con tener su propio terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elena is 20 years old and studied up to Grade8. She is married and together with her husband works in agriculture. She has one son and is pregnant.

Elena helps her husband growing corn, sorghum and they also grow squash as where they live a lot of this crop is produced. Besides growing they raise chickens and pigs. Their crops are one km from their house and they walk there as they have no other means of transportation.

Elena gets up at 5 am to prepare breakfast and takes the child to her mother's house so she can take care of him. Then she goes out and works with her husband until 11 am as then she has to return home and feed the animals.

The loan will be used to buy corn and squash seeds and manure for her crops. She dreams of finishing her studies to have better opportunities in the future and provide better living conditions for her children. She also dreams of having her own land and building her own house.

loans.use: to buy corn and squash seeds and buy manure for her crops.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 52-year-old married man from the village Khidari. He has a wife, daughter and son. The only breadwinner in the family is Gocha, who is involved in agricultural activities. Particularly, he takes care of a cow, harvests nuts and sells agricultural products locally. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live under poverty.  

According to above mentioned situation, Gocha lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 1,300 GEL to start an additional business.

He plans to purchase all the needed tools and equipment for a wood factory to start making chairs. Gocha will sell the chairs to the local market at a good price and will get the chance to get additional income for his family's welfare. The family really requires financial support, as they find it hard to make minimum wage for existence. Gocha awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for a workshop to make chairs

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Eya est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans et mère de deux enfants. Eya vit  à Gbomamé pour entreprendre son activité. Elle vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier. Eya s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Amouzoukopé. Eya demande ce crédit pour acheter des paniers de tomates et ses produits de vente. Eya désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Eya is a 34-year-old married mother of two children. She lives in Gbomamé where she runs her business. She sells general food products in the neighborhood and resupplies once a month at the market in Amouzoukopé.

Eya is requesting this loan to buy baskets of tomatoes and the food products she resells. She wants to make profits to help her husband with family expenses and ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy four baskets of tomatoes and bags of onions

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 54 years old and has seven children. Anita is a widow.

Anita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 53 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Corazon has a business buying and selling aluminum and glassware in the Philippines. Corazon has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more aluminum and glass for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is seeking a new loan to continue building her business.  Corazon has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more aluminum and glassware for her business.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is 55 years old, separated, and has seven children. With two children in school, Ophelia works very hard to provide for them.  Ophelia runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including eggs, snacks, canned goods and groceries.  Ophelia has been in this business for two years.   In the future, Ophelia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including eggs, snacks, canned goods and groceries.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives in the village of Baghaberd in the Syunik region. He is married and he has three school-aged sons. His wife is unemployed and she is the perfect house-wife. 
 
For many years Davit has made cargo transfers in his own car from different regions to Yerevan and back. Besides this, he also has another occupation; he has agricultural machinery, that is, a combine and a tractor. This machinery brings good income since he gives agricultural services by order from villagers from the whole region. With the coming of spring, Davit already has a list of orders that await their turn of sowing activities and clearing their farms of weeds, etc. 

For these activities, Davit wants to refresh and keep his machinery ready. By the help of a Kiva loan, which he hopes to receive, he wants to buy new tires and diesel fuel, and also to do some repair work on his agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to buy new tires, diesel fuel and also to do some repair work on his agricultural machinery

loans.name: Museruko Group

texts.fr:
Joséphine fait partie du groupe  Museruko  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 54 ans et est marié à Elie, une infirmière .Ensemble ils ont 8  enfants âgés de 12 à 25 ans, dont  4 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 3 orphelins. 

Elle  fait le commerce de  tomates, et de bananes depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une  grande quantité de tomates et de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter  une parcelle, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Josephine is part of the Museruko group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 54 years old and is married to Elie, a nurse. Together they have eight children from 12 to 25 years old, of whom four attend school. She also cares for three orphans.

She has been trading tomatoes and bananas for the past 20 years.

She is on her second loan with Turame. She will use the Kiva loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes and bananas for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land, and see to her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital so she can buy large quantities of tomatoes and bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Ciro Antonio

texts.es:
Ciro, esta recolectando su cosecha y necesita capital para comprar sacos, lazos, matates y un silo metálico, trasladara la cosecha con mayor facilidad y la almacenara para alimentar a su familia.
Con el financiamiento anterior obtuvo la cosecha esperada y no ha enfrentado dificultades para seguir trabajando en el campo, tiene nuevos clientes, está optimizando el estilo de vida familiar y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
Ciro is harvesting his crops and needs funds to purchase to purchase bags, ties, canvas sacks, and a metal silo. These items will allow Ciro to transport his crops more easily and store them for his family's use. 

Ciro's prior loan allowed him to achieve the harvest he was aiming for, and he's since been able to keep operating his farm without any problems. He has new customers and is improving his family's quality of life while repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags, ties, canvas sacks, and a metal silo, which will allow him to transport the harvest more easily and store the crop for feeding his family.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Khelvachauri district. Her husband works as a cook locally and gets a monthly salary. 

Tea has decided to start farming and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. With the received credit she will start poultry farming. She already has a space in her yard where she will raise chickens. She will purchase chickens and will sell eggs and raised hens in future. 

Tea is a very hardworking woman and thinks that the business will be profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en: Beatrice, pictured above, is the group leader representing her group, consisting of six farmers from Kakamega North District, Kenya. She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011. She decided to represent her group because she wants to spread the story of the One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has two children.  With her portion of this loan, Beatrice will purchase not only maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar lamp. Receiving a solar lamp as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Beatrice plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school. In total, Beatrice’s Group will be able to use the inputs received with this loan to plant 3.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lamps.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Las ganas de ver realizados académicamente a sus hijos es la principal meta de Doña Gloria, esta vez es el turno de su hijo menor. Ella desea que su hijo estudie ingles para que de esta manera pueda desenvolverse en el mundo laboral una vez que termine sus estudios secundarios y luego sus estudios de la universidad. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para pagar el curso completo de ingles y luego continuar con la preparación académica de su hijo en la universidad.
texts.en: Gloria's main goal is to see her children finish their academic education. This time, it is her youngest son's turn. Gloria hopes to help her son study English so that he will be able to compete in the labor market once he finishes his high school education and college studies. For this reason, she is requesting a loan: to pay for the English course and further prepare her son to go to college.

loans.use: to pay for an English course.

loans.name: Aman

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Aman est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Aman vit à Agoè pour exercer efficacement son activité. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Aman vend de la pate préparée à base de l’arachide. Cette activité lui procure un gain qui ne couvre pas suffisamment ses besoins. Aman s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Agoè. Aman nécessite ce crédit pour commander des bols d’arachide afin de satisfaire favorablement les besoins de ses consommateurs.
texts.en:
Aman is a 44-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Agoè where she can effectively run her business.

To foster her family's development, Aman sells mush prepared from groundnuts. Profits from this activity do not adequately cover her needs.

Aman resupplies twice a month at the market in Agoè. She is requesting this loan so she can order bowls of groundnuts and favorably satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: buy 35 bowls of groundnuts

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: A native of a village of Battambang Province’s Kos Krolo district, Yan is 47 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice and working as paid workers as their primary sources of income, and they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day. Yan has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles, and she wisely and successfully used her first loan to improve her living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan to buy corn seed for her farm. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland, to increase her production, and to improve her family’s life style.

loans.use: to buy corn seed for her farm.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar, 43, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has one child. For the last 25 years, Sar has been farming rice to make a living. The current business earns her family about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Sar has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already and she has completely repaid the loans. She has used her past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for anther loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Sokun, 48, is married and lives with her family in a rural area in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province. She earns a living by farming rice and corn, as she has been doing for 15 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 30,000 per day from their current work. This is Sokun’s third loan from VisionFund. She is applying for this loan to buy corn seed for her farm. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland, so as to increase her production and better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seed for her farm.

loans.name: Nevaditas De Corapata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE CORAPATA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladiz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, servicio de construcción, venta de leche, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladiz es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche y queso; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña trabaja con este producto, al adquirir un vaca inicia un negocio independiente hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza, realizará la elaboración de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los beneficios que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank group “NEVADITAS DE CORAPATA” will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana initiative. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of which, Gladiz is the president. The businesses that the group's members carry out are various and include: cheese sales, construction services, milk sales, and blanket sales. 

This loan will help small business owners in Gladiz's group. She has been part of Pro Mujer for three years. She joined at the invitation of a massive promotion the institution carried out in her area. Currently, Gladiz runs a business selling milk and cheese. She learned this trade from her parents so she has been producing dairy products since she was a little girl. Upon acquiring a cow, she opened her own business a few years ago.
 
This loan that she is requesting will help her increase her capital (by buying cows). She will get them from wholesale vendors in her community and, after raising them, she will make dairy products from their milk. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially now that she is single and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the benefits the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is 43 years old and married with three children.

Maria Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Maria Gina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Maria Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Seth's Group

texts.en:
Seth's Group is formed by eight farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Seth, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 42 years old, is married and has four children. Seth has been a farmer for thirteen years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Seth isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since.

This year, Seth will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Seth's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rodilla

texts.en:
Rodilla is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rodilla is 33 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Rodilla has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rodilla has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 19 years now.

Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Teav

texts.en:
Teav lives in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 31 years old and married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school.

To support her family, she has been working as a paid worker and farmer. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to make a living.

This is Teav’s third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo, es soltera, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa interior para generar los ingresos necesarios para ir cubriendo las necesidades básicas familiares, el negocio lo aprendió con la ayuda de una amiga y como su propia actividad la tiene desde hace  2 años, su horario es de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde.
Con el capital comprara pantaletas, blúmeres, fustanes y brasieres, mejorar á el inventario para atender bien  a sus clientes, espera que su situación económica mejore y pueda resarcir su deuda con mucha puntualidad.
Sus sueños son tener en el futuro un bazar con diferente mercadería y salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa, who lives with her son, is single and has a business selling women's undergarments to generate the necessary income to pay for her family's basic necessities. She learned her business with the help of a friend and has actively made the business her own for some two years now. Her daily work schedule is from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm.

With this new capital, Rosa will purchase panties, bloomers, petticoats and brassieres to improve her inventory in order to attend to her customers better.  She promises to pay off her debt very punctually.

Rosa's dreams are to have her own shop with a variety of merchandise and to advance together with her son.

loans.use: to buy panties, bloomers, petticoats, and brassieres and improve her inventory, better serving her customers.

loans.name: Nerri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! It’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Nerri. Nerri lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her children. She owns a small stall where she sells snacks and provides mobile payment services for her community. Nerri joined Ruma in 2014 and this is the second time she has applied for a loan from Kiva.
