The previous loan helped her to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community and she thanks all of the lenders for it.

With support from Ruma staff, Nerri has seen improvement in her business. Now, as the business grows, Nerri is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful in helping Nerri improve her business and help her community, who need access to such services. 

Nerri is the sitting woman in the photo. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 8 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, gracias a las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Josefa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Josefa is 45 years old and lives in a house that she owns along with her daughter. She has made a living producing clothing for the last eight years. Her workshop is located in her home. She has many customers due to the quality of her clothing. Thanks to her earnings from this work, she is able to pay her household expenses. Josefa is requesting a loan in order to buy thread, needles, a variety of cloth, buttons, elastics, etc. and continue her work to generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of cloth, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, 43, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristina has a general store business in the Philippines. Cristina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cristina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business, which she has been in for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Veronica is 62 years old and has eight children who are in school.

Veronica has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her business.

Veronica has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other needed materials

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys es una humilde mujer de 37 años de edad, que aprovecha cada espacio de su casa para generar recursos con los cuales pueda mantener su familia, sus dos hijos de 5y 17 años de edad. 
Su actividad económica consta de servicios de hospedaje, como se puede ver en la foto son habitaciones muy sencillas, pero su negocio presenta algunos problemas que son unas humedades de las cuales se le están quejando sus clientes, por este motivo quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar las reparaciones necesarias, con el resto del capital comprara camas y colchonetas.
Su sueño es poder comprar una casa para seguir realizando esta labor, le gusta servir y estar rodeada de personas.
texts.en:
Gladys is a humble 37-year-old woman who takes advantage of every space in her house in order to generate resources with which to support her family, her two children aged 5 and 17.

Her work consists of hospitality services. As you can see in the photo, they are very simple rooms, but her business presents some problems, namely dampness that her customers are complaining about. For this reason she wants to request a loan in order to make the necessary repairs. With the rest of the capital, she will buy beds and mats.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house in order to continue doing this work. She likes to serve and be surrounded by people.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs; with the rest of the capital, she will buy beds and mats

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teresa works hard to support her family.

Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear goods. She is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other needed materials for her fishing business.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other needed materials.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a 45-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in the Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Nancy has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Nancy described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study with. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Nancy’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Ry is 42 years old and married. She has two children who are still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and corn planting. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Ry has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burden. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more healthy rice and corn so as to increase her family’s income, better her living condition, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 25 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de alimentos, concentrado y vitamina para el ganado y así poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Victor, 50 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has raised dairy cattle for 25 years. He sells his products in the surrounding areas and with what he earns from his sales he is able to move forward with the household expenses. He is asking for a loan in order to buy feed, concentrate, and vitamins for the cattle and in this way be able to continue with his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy feed, concentrate, and vitamins for the cattle

loans.name: Maryori Del Rosio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Maryori, tiene 43  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos,  5 mayores de edad y uno de 17 años que trabaja, con ellos vive  un nieto de 8 años  que estudia en el tercer año básico. Su esposo es ebanista y viven en casa propia.
Doña Maryori es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar, ella realiza los créditos para compartirlo con su esposo, él tiene una  ebanistería desde hace treinta años, el realiza muebles de todo tipo (puertas, roperos, camas, etc.). Ella en su casa tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de chanchos los mismos que una vez estén con un peso adecuado los vende en pie a comerciantes o los faena y vende por libras a vecinos del lugar, de esta forma ella también se gana lo suyo que junto  a lo de su marido les da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar madera, pinturas y alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. Su sueño es poder reparar su casa.
texts.en:
The La Sequita communal bank meets in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi, a prosperous Manta neighborhood filled with hard working people dedicated to and proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Maryori lives in this place. She is 43 years old, married and from this relationship they have 6 children, 5 adults and one 17 year old who works. An 8 year old grandson studying in the third grade lives with them. Her husband is a cabinet maker and they live in their own home. 

Maryori is a very good wife who tries to help her husband with the difficult household burden. She takes out the loans to share with her husband. He has had a cabinet making shop for 30 years. He makes all types of furniture (doors, closets, beds, etc.). She has a small farm at her house in which she works raising pigs. Once they are of an adequate weight she sells them whole to traders or laborers and she sells by the pound to her neighbors. In this way, she also earns her own and along with that of her husband gives them the basics to continue forward. 

She is going to use this loan to buy wood, paint and food and medicine for the pigs. She has been here since the start of the communal bank and likes it because of the help they have given her with the loans. Her dream is to recondition her home.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint and food and medicine for pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 51 years old and married with five children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 36 years now. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Tessie works very hard to provide for them.

Tessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 30 years old and married with four children.

Genelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Genelyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Genelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Lorna has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more meat to sell to her customers.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marlyn Yaneth

texts.es:
Marlyn, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y tienen tres hijos.

Marlyn, es ama de casa, pero también le ayuda a su pareja en la siembra de maíz, maicillo y ajonjolí; la necesidad de obtener ingresos para su familia, la obligo a aprender el trabajo en el campo.- Marlyn, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, de lo cual obtiene ingresos extras.- Los cultivo están a 1 kilómetro de su casa y para llegar hasta ese lugar se van a caminando, ella se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana, para hacer los oficios de su hogar y darles el desayuno a sus hijos, para mandarlos a la escuela, luego le lleva el desayuno a su pareja y se queda ayudandole a trabajar hasta las 11:00 a.m. porque tiene que llegar a recibir a sus hijos, para darles el almuerzo cuando llegan de la escuela.

El préstamo lo va utilizar para pagar el alquiler de 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno y para comprar semilla, abono y herbicida para el cultivo.

El sueño de Marlyn, es que sus hijos sean profesionales, ya que ella no pudo estudiar.- Además, tiene el deseo de construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que la que tiene es de barro.
texts.en:
Marlyn, 30, studied up to the fifth grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner works in agriculture. They have three children.

Marlyn is a housewife, but she also helps her partner with planting corn, sorghum, and sesame, as the need to earn an income for her family required her to learn farm work, and she also has a small chicken coop from which she earns extra income.  The crops are one kilometer’s distance from their house, and they walk to get there. She gets up at 4:30 in the morning in order to do her household chores and give her children breakfast before sending them off to school.  Then she brings breakfast to her partner and stays to help him work until 11:00 A.M., because she has to be home to give her children lunch when they come home from school.

She is going to use the loan to pay the rent for 7,000 square meters of land [1.72 acres], and to purchase seed, compost, and herbicide for the crops.

Marlyn’s dream is that her children may become professionals, as she was not able to attend school. In addition, she would like to build a house of brick, as the one that she has is made of adobe.

loans.use: to pay the rent for 7,000 square meters [1.72 acres] of land, and to purchase seed, compost, and herbicide for the crops.

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.en:
Augustine is 64 years old and has 8 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Augustine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Augustine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Augustine's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
These two members are part of the group called Adjorman and are mother and father. They are from Teshie, a place that is located in the Accra region. 

All of them have different work. Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources, they could not go to school to the high level, and they saw the need to work from an early age.

They have come to ID-Ghana for a loan to better their life and improve their business. 

Victoria will be a beneficiary of this loan and use her position to buy foodstuff (cassava, plantain, cocoyam, yams, vegetables, sardines). 

She has been doing this work for 15 years and operates from morning to evening. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of cassava, plantain, cocoyam, yams, vegetables and sardines. 

Victoria is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources to earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff (cassava, plantain, cocoyam, yams, vegetables, sardines) to sell to customers

loans.name: Nikleby Weider

texts.es:
Nikleby tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una comunidad del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de albañilería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra y mantenimiento de sus herramientas que le permitan realizar con mayor rapidez su trabajo así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde las guarda, de esta manera el espera tener otros contratos que le generen mayores ingresos para su familia y de esta manera le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nikleby is 31 years old. He is single and lives in a community in the Oyotún district. Its population works in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He works as a bricklayer. He has his own tools and has more than 5 years of experience in the business. He has asked for a loan to buy and maintain his tools that allow him to do his work more quickly as well as to perform repairs to the place where he keeps them. In this way, he hopes to have other contracts that generate more income for his family and allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more tools as well as to perform repairs on the place where he keeps them

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 3 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ella logra salir adelante con sus gastos, Mari esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 48 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and her two children. For 3 years, she has had a store located in her place of residence. With what she earns from her sales, she is able to move forward with her expenses. Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy sweets, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc., and in this way be able to continue with her sales that generate a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Chahida

texts.en:
Chahida is a 29-year-old married mother of four children. She opened a grocery shop a year ago to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children.

Chahida is an ambitious lady and a hard worker who is trying her best to develop her business. 

Thus, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Chahida hopes to expand her business more in the future in order to stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new products to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man who started working as a barber a year ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man who succeeded in gaining loyal customers in this short period of time, as he is working hard to develop his business. Mahmoud is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary hair tools to facilitate his business and satisfy his customers' special requests. 

Mahmoud hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary hair tools to facilitate his business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será para brindar mantenimiento del lugar donde cría a sus animales asi como para la compra de más animales para implementar su negocio, con esto Josefa espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir satisfacer sus gustos y preferencias, esto le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is 48 years old and in a cohabitating union. She lives with her family in the Nueva Arica district. It is a rural area located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district work primarily in farming, trade and animal raising. 

She works raising and selling animals like chickens, ducks and turkeys, among others. She has done this work for more than 3 years and has good personal and professional references in the area. 

The loan will be for providing maintenance to the area where she raises her animals as well as for buying more animals for implementing her business. 

With this, Josefa hopes to offer more variety of animals to her customers which will allow her to satisfy their tastes and preferences. This will allow her to increase her level of income and in the end, improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to the area where she raises her animals as well as to buy more animals for implementing her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale parts for cell phones and accessories such as chargers, cases, and headphones, among others

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is a 66-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Maguli and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and sell wine and vodka locally. 

Maguli decided to start husbandry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,700 GEL. 

With the received credit she will purchase a cow. She will start producing dairy products and will sell them to generate income. Maguli will be able to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Dennis's Group

texts.en:
"Dennis's Group" is formed by 6 farmers in the Kakamega North District and is being represented by Dennis, who is the group leader pictured above.

 He is 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. Dennis has been a farmer for 4 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Dennis isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, Dennis will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Dennis's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lariza

texts.en:
Lariza, who is 54-year-old woman, lives in the small village of Sazano. She has husband, son and daughter-in-law. Her son gets a fixed salary of about 400 GEL. 

Lariza works hard on her agribusiness to make better living conditions for her family. In particular, she cultivates a plot of agricultural land and also takes care of 2 milk cows. 

She gets seasonal income from this business, but as this income is really hardly enough to cover even basic needs, after the season especially, she decided to start an additional business. 

Lazira requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

Lariza then requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start up loan program provides start up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Lariza will start a trading business with fruits and vegetables at the local market and will have her own loyal customers.
  
The loan will greatly assist Lariza and she will be able to develop this trading business and make her income more stable. She will be very thankful for the loan and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To start a trading business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Wilimina's Group

texts.en:
Wilimina's Group is formed by eight farmers in the Kakamega North District. They are being represented by Wilimina, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 57 years old, married and has four children. Wilimina has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Wilimina isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Wilimina will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Wilimina's Group will purchase a total of six solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 44 years old and is a married woman. She works in her home as a tailor. She has experience of many years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Nasreen was not earning her family was going through severe financial crisis because her husband was the sole bread earner of the family. This compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. She is a brave woman and works hard to improve their standard of living. 

She manages a good clientele but she is facing difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Therefore she has requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase packs of threads, zippers, laces, buttons and other stitching material. She expects a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase packs of threads, zippers, laces, buttons and other stitching material.

loans.name: Razoa's Group

texts.en:
Razoa is a 44-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in the Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Razoa has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Razoa described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Razoa’s Group will be able to plant a total of six acres of land and purchase a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Syeeda Nuzhat

texts.en:
Syeeda Nuzhat is a 30-year-old married women. She has been running a school in her community for the last 10  years. 

She was always passionate about contributing to the cause of education for the marginalized children in her community. As soon as she completed her own education, she opened a school. Today, there are over 150 students in her school. 

She requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy chairs and desks for her students and to repair her school building. She wants to grow her school and improve the stand of education she provides.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her students and to repair her school building.

loans.name: Dorine's Group

texts.en:
Dorine, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Dorine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Dorine plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Dorine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more high quality spare parts to increase her son's sales and profits.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a married mother of 3 children. 

Some time ago, one of her sons, who is also shown in the photo above, started a business driving a taxi. He earns a good income, though he needs some financial help to pay for the repair and maintenance of his taxi. 

Therefore, Shameem requested a murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR on behalf of her son. She is hopeful that both her son’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her son's taxi.

loans.name: Redon's Group

texts.en:
Redon is a 50-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of seven farmers in the Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Redon has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Redon described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Redon’s Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa Adeli

texts.es: Rosa de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos nietas, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, además de eso vende tortillas, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55, lives in her own house with her husband and their two granddaughters.  For several years, she has had a small store located in her place of residence, and in addition to that, she sells tortillas. 

She has a lot of customers because of the variety of products that she sells and the good prices, and with what she earns from her work, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. 

Rosa is requesting a loan for the purchase of soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc. In this way, she can have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Giribakwe Group

texts.en:
Giribakwe is a group led by Consolee who is 53 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 14 and 28 years. Their group's name Giribakwe means “work hard” in English. 

Consolee sells food stuffs. She has been selling as a business for 10 years now, and her husband earns income as a farmer. While the group members sell different items, they nonetheless all share the same idea for changing their lives. 

With this loan, Consolee would like to buy more beans and groundnuts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. She also plans to be able to save income in future.

loans.use: to buy more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

She has been in the agricultural business of pig fattening  in the Philippines for 2 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Rosalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen Theresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aileen Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Aileen Theresa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items like shorts, pants, blouses, etc. to sell to her customers from her ready to wear business.

Aileen Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like shorts, pants, blouses, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production and vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. 

Perlita has been in this business for 5 years. Perlita earns additional income from raising pigs.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a breeding sow.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
José es un comerciante de Limones su negocio es ir por las calles de puerto Boyacá en su motocicleta distribuyendo su producto a sus clientes, la motocicleta es muy importante dado que los desplazamientos son muy largos y si en algo se caracteriza José es en su puntualidad en tiempos de entrega.
Este hombre es muy creativo y para masificar sus ganancias el mismo planto los palos de limones, ganando casi el 100% a su producto. 
José en el momento presenta un inconveniente, su moto presenta fallas de motores y necesita un cambio, José no tiene el capital para realizar el cambio y al ser la moto un elemento tan importante en su negocio necesita con urgencia un apoyo financiero para erradicar de raíz este problema.
Con su forma de ganarse la vida, mantiene una familia conformada por un adolecente de 17 años y su pareja.
texts.en:
José is a lime salesman. His business is to go through the streets of Puerto Boyacá on his motorcycle, distributing his product to his customers. The motorcycle is very important, given that his journeys are very long and something that characterizes Jośe is his punctuality in delivery times.

This man is very creative and to expand his earnings, he plants his own lime saplings, earning in this way almost 100% of his product.

José at this time has a difficulty, his motorcycle has problems in the engine and needs a replacement. José doesn't have the capital to make the replacement and since the motorcycle is an element so important to his business, he needs a loan urgently to eradicate the root of this problem. 

With his way of earning a living, he supports his family made up of a 17-year-old adolescent and his partner.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on his work motorcycle.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Desde el año 1996 el señor José ha caminado por las calles de Medellín vendiendo sus productos de pescado y queso, contagiando a todos con su alegría, su buen humor su entusiasmo y su sencilla manera de ver la vida, el empuja su carreta y grita queso, pescado… pescado!, con este trabajo al cual le invierte entre 8 y 10 horas logra generar el sustento para alimentar una familia conformada por él, su esposa y sus 4 hijos.
José busca ser más competitivo, engrandecer su negocio para dejarlo a sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
José Solicita  un préstamo para la compra de pescado y queso, y seguir no solo distribuyendo sus productos, si no que llevando su buena energía, su alegría y carisma a los hogares de Medellín.
texts.en:
Since 1996, José has walked through the streets of Medellín selling his products of fish and cheese, infecting everyone with his joy, his good mood, his enthusiasm, and his simple way of seeing life. He pushes his cart and shouts "cheese, fish...fish!"  With this work, in which he invests between 8 and 10 hours, he manages to generate the sustenance to feed a family made up of himself, his wife, and their four children.

José looks to be more competitive, expand his business, to leave it to his children, and improve the conditions of his house.

José asks for a loan to purchase fish and cheese, and to continue not only distributing his products, but also carrying his good energy, his happiness, and his charisma to the homes in Medellín.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cheese for his business.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard is 32 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Richard has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Richard also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Richard's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and for many years she has been running a business buying and selling cattle. She buys baby goats and calves from the local market, looks after them and then sells them to different communities. She earns enough through her business to meet day-to-day expenses of her family. 

Samina is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy more baby goats and calves. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Auma's Group

texts.en:
Auma is a 45-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 9 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Auma has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Auma described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is also very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize seed, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Auma’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Shown with her husband in the photo above, Naseem is a 60-year-old woman who runs a small home boutique in order to provide for her family. 

Naseem purchases cloth from the market at low prices, which she sews into clothing and then sells to the people in her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she is able to earn a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Naseem has taken a murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR so she can buy spools of thread in various colors and a greater variety of cloth. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy both spools of thread in various colors and a greater variety of cloth.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 58-year-old married women. She has been running a small general store for many years with her husband (also shown in the photo). They sell toffees, biscuits and cold drinks etc. and manage to earn reasonable amount of income to support their family. Her husband assists her by purchasing items from the market. 

Nagina is a loving mother and is responsible for her children's food, health and clothing through their business. 

For the improvement of their business Nagina contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase packs of sugar, rice, salt and other food items in order to boost their earnings and meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase packs of sugar, rice, salt and other food items.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina has successfully built her business purchasing and selling cattle with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time, she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her sales to more customers and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 28 years old and is a married woman. Together with her husband, she has been doing agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds, packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Robina has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza  is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes that she milks. 

She is happily supporting her family with the income that she generates. She also sells animals to earn some extra amount of income. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Santusa Leonora

texts.es:
Santusa es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija mujer de 12 años y un hijo varón de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es buen madre, emprendedora, constante, independiente, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Villa el Carmen’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse la terminal de buses con destino al norte de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con fuertes vientos fríos que llegan desde la cordillera.
Santusa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como; hamburpapa (hamburguesas con papas fritas), salchipapas (salchichas con papas fritas), salchiarroz (salchicha con arroz), y otros, labor que realiza durante 6 horas diarias de lunes a domingo en un puesto de venta fijo bajo techo. “quisiera dedicarme al 100 por ciento a mi negocio, pero hago de padre y madre y eso me quita mucho tiempo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio popular muy visitado por sus clientes para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; papas por arroba, salchichas por mayor y desea tambi´+en renovar sus ollas, sartenes y planchas que utiliza a diario para su negocio. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Santusa solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina y renovar sus ollas y sartenes para cocinar en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Santusa is a 41-year-old single woman. She has a 12-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. Her business is fast food. She is a good mother, is entrepreneurial, tenacious, independent, committed to her work, responsible, and hardworking. She carries out her business in ‘Villa el Carmen,’ an area characterized by the bus terminal that goes to the north of the city, of cold and dry weather with strong, cold winds that arrive from the mountain range.

Santusa has dark complexion, long black hair that she wears braided, dark eyes, is short in height, and has a robust physique. Her primary language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for her business. She shares her life with her children who study in school. They live in a rented room that has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Her business is selling fast food such as hamburpapa (hamburgers with french fries), salchipapas (sausages with french fries), salchiarroz (sausage with rice), and other things. She carries out her work during six-hour days from Monday to Sunday in a fixed stall under a roof. “I would like to dedicate myself 100 percent to my business, but I am both father and mother and that takes a lot of time…” she says. 

Her dream is to have a popular business that her customers visit frequently. In order to improve her children’s quality of life, she wishes to invest in her business through the purchase of cooking supplies like potatoes, wholesale sausages, and she also wishes to restore her pots, pans, and griddles that she uses everyday for her business. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in six years that she is doing independently. For these reasons, Santusa requests a loan to purchase cooking supplies and restore her pots and pans in order to cook in perfect conditions.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and restore her pots and pans  in order to cook in perfect conditions.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan, 46 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has earned a good client base.

To avoid shortages, Hameedan requires various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to buy additional grocery items such as oil, milk, sugar, and juices so she can consistently satisfy increasing customer demand and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as oil, milk, sugar, and juices to consistently meet her increasing customer demand and make better earnings.

loans.name: Segundo Francisco

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 45 años de edad es viudo, tiene 2 hijos y vive en guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Pimbalo. 

El pertenece a la ventanilla rural los Emprendedores Bolivarenses que se encuentra formada por un grupo de agricultores que se dedican a la agricultura, ganaderia y al comercio.
Segundo es un agricultor hace algun tiempo, solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas para engordarles y asi vender para obtener ganancias ya que el solo sustenta a sus dos hijos, gracias al credito podra mejorar economicamente ya que es una ayuda rapida para poder producir y comercializar.
En su tiempo libre le gusta pasear con sus hijos en el parque y jugar.
texts.en:
Segundo is 45 years old, a widower, has 2 children, and lives in Guaranda, in Bolivar Province, in Pimbalo community. 

He belongs to the rural "window" of Los Emprendedores Bolivarenses which is formed by a group of farmers who work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. 

Segundo has been a farmer for some time, and asks for the loan to purchase chickens to fatten them and then sell them to get earnings, since he supports his two children alone. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to improve economically since it is a quick help to be able to produce and sell. 

In his free time, he likes to walk in the park with his children and play.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Faber De Jesus

texts.es:
Faber un tendero de 32 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos, que inicio pro necesidad económica y por vocación al trabajo independiente su tienda de abarrotes, es muy cariñoso y preocupado por sus tres criaturas tan solo tienen 4, 5, 8 años de edad, trata de que tengan juguetes estudios y juegos didácticos para que crezcan y sean muy inteligentes.
Toda la responsabilidad y gastos del hogar recae sobre sus hombros y él se apoyó en su tienda para generar ingresos y no dejar pasar nunca necesidades a su familia, es de las personas que se quita el bocado de su boca con tal de dárselos a sus hijos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como lo son licores, latas de sardinas, refrescos, aceite, harina, sal, frijoles y otros granos, y se ubicó en un lugar estratégico en la foto par que observen los productos que con su ayuda podría comprar para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Faber is a 32 year old storekeeper and father of three children.  He started, for economic needs and for a job, his own grocery store.  He is very caring and concerned for his three kids who are only 4, 5, and 8 years old.  He tries to have educational toys and games so that they grow and are very intelligent.

All of the responsibilities and household expenses fall on his shoulders, and he supports himself in his store to generate income and never leave his family in need.  He is the kind of person to take the food from his mouth and give it to his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy input like liquors, canned sardines, soft drinks, oil, flour, beans, and other grain.  He is located strategically in the photo so that you can see the products that with your help he could buy to supply his business.

loans.use: To buy input  like liquor, canned sardines, soft drinks, oil, flour salt, beans, and other grains.

loans.name: Nasael Antonio

texts.es:
Nasael es el propietario ebanistería, donde se encarga de la creación y reparación de muebles fabricados en madera, a sus 52 años de edad tiene gran bagaje en esta profesión, todo inicio en el negocio de un conocido donde aprendió las habilidades y conocimientos, pero su pensamiento y proyecciones siempre estuvieron enfocados en crear empresa y lo logro y gracias a su negocio ha mejorado considerablemente la vida de su familia que la conforman su pareja y sus 6 hijos.
Su propósito es siempre estar hay para ellos ayudarlos en momentos complicados, tanto monetaria como moralmente, al ser su familia tan grande necesita de ingresos considerables y solo lo puede lograr aumentando sus ventas de muebles y atrayendo más clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramienta de mano que le hace falta y materia prima que sería madera, clavos, y aerosol para pintar los muebles, también espuma y telas y cuero para forrar sus obras de arte.
texts.en:
Nasael owns a woodworking shop, where he is responsible for making and repairing furniture made of wood. At 52 years old, he has a lot of experience in this profession, which all began in the business of someone he knew where he learned his skills and knowledge, but his thinking and plans always were focused on creating a business and he achieved it and, thanks to his business, he has improved life for his family considerably, which is made up of his partner and their 6 children.

His goal is always be there for them, helping them in difficult times, both financially and morally. Being such a large family, he needs considerable income and only manages to get it by expanding his furniture sales and attracting more customers. For this reason, he asks for a loan to purchase hand tools that he lacks, and raw material which would be wood, nails, and spay paint to paint his furniture, also foam, fabric, and leather to upholster his works of art.

loans.use: to purchase hand tools he lacks, and raw materials which would be wood, nails and spray paint.

loans.name: Marcelina Rachel

texts.es:
Desde niña, Marcelina se caracterizaba  por ayudar a los demás, no había ocasión en que ella dejará lo que estaba haciendo, para ir en auxilio de sus amigos, incluso, su juego preferido era simular ser doctora. Siempre se visualizó vestida de blanco, cuidando a sus enfermos. Por estas razones cuando tomó la dedición sobre qué carrera universitaria estudiar, no dudo en escoger el área de la medicina. 

Actualmente, esta joven ésta a un paso de convertirse en licenciada en enfermería. Por ello, solicita un crédito para cubrir los gastos de titulación. Lo cual, le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá iniciar su vida laboral y podrá desarrollar sus habilidades en pro de los demás. También, ayudará a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Since she was a child, Marcelina has been known for helping others, and there was never an instance where she wouldn’t stop what she was doing to help her friends.  Even her favorite game was playing doctor.  She always imagined herself dressed in white, caring for her patients.  For these reasons, when making the decision about which career to study for in college, she didn’t hesitate to choose medicine.

Currently, this young woman is one step away from becoming a registered nurse, and she is requesting a loan to pay the costs of her professional credentials.  This will be very helpful in enabling her to begin her working life, and help her develop her skills in caring for others.  In addition, it will help her household economy.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her professional credentials.

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz Mariela ella es soltera y tiene 26 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y tambien la socia es enfermera, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Los Lideres” [The Leaders] communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province and department of Cusco.  

The member, Liz Mariela, is 26 years old and single.  Her business is selling beauty products, and she is also a nurse.  She sells lipstick, creams, and perfumes, working from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has been engaged in this business for several years, and her dream is to have a local where she can sell her beauty products.  She is requesting the loan to purchase creams, lipstick, and perfumes.

The other members are engaged in businesses where they sell beauty products, clothing, groceries, and books.  Mariela is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way, and promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase creams, lipstick, and perfumes.

loans.name: Alcides Rigoberto

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 65 años de edad vive con sus hermanos ya que es soltero en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Achachi. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Los Emprendedores Bolivarenses y se dedican a la agricultura. 

El es agricultor hace algunos años siembra maiz trigo tiene ganado y solicita el credito para la compra de semillas e insumos agricolas para sembrar cebada, gracias al crédito podra sembrar ya que tiene un terreno vacio y le va hacer producir que por falta de dinero no lo hacia, en su tiempo libres le gusta hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Alcides is 65 years old.  He lives with this siblings, since he is single, in the Guaranda province of Bolivar in the community Achachi.  He is from the small rural group Los Emprendedores Bolivarenses (The Bolivar Entrepreneurs) , and he makes a living in agriculture.  He is a farmer.  Some years ago, he planted corn and wheat.  He has cattle.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to plant barley.  Thanks to the loan, he could plant since he has open land and he is going to make it produce because he lacks money.  In this free time he likes to make friends in the community.

loans.use: To buy barley seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 37 years old and married with two children. 

Lorena is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorena has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es:
Ella es María Bernarda es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora, de 45 años de edad, polivalente que aprecia cada minuto de un día, se dedica a las actividades de la confección y venta de alimentos, cuando no está en una actividad de inmediato se ocupa en otra y aunque sea muy desgastante físicamente lo hace pro que ella genera la única entrada de dinero en un casa que la comparte junto con sus 3 hijos, se separó de su pareja y asumió toda la responsabilidades económicas.
Ella desea capacitar a sus hijos, para que un día tomen lo que ahora se esta convirtiendo en el negocio familiar y su objetivo es dejarles un gran legado pro eso trabaja para hacer crecer su negocio y que tenga buena rentabilidad.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de maquinaria, insumos de confección e insumos para preparar sus platos.
texts.en:
María Bernarda is a hardworking, determined, and multi-skilled 45-year-old woman who appreciates every minute of the day. She works in dressmaking and food sales. When she is not working she immediately takes on another business. Although it may be very physically tiring, she does it because she is the only person bringing income into the house that she shares together with her three children. She separated from her partner and assumed all of the economic responsibility. 

She wishes to teach her children so that someday they can take what is now becoming the family business. Her goal is to leave them a great legacy, and that is why she works to make her business grow and have good profitability. 

She requests a loan to buy machinery, dressmaking supplies, and supplies to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy machinery, dressmaking supplies, and supplies to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Gloria Estella

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer adorable de 54 años de edad, la energía, el entusiasmo y el amor que siente por los niños se ve muy reflejado en su actividad económica pues tiene una Guardería ofreciendo a los padres bajos precios y un lugar de confianza para tener sus niños, ella es madre soltera con un hijo de 19 años de edad. 
Su sueño lo cumple cada día es ver la evolución que tienen sus pequeños como crecen y aprenden cosas nuevas.
Gloria se encuentra ante ustedes con una solicitud y es un que le den un apoyo para realizar algunas reformas locativas donde los beneficiados serán exclusivamente los niños, la reforma que hará es adecuar un patio de su hogar para la recreación de los niños.
texts.en:
Gloria is a lovely woman, age 54.  The energy, enthusiasm, and love that she feels for children is very much reflected in her work, as she has a nursery school where she provides parents with a low cost, safe place for their children. She is a single mother with a 19-year-old son.

She fulfills her dream every day, as it is watching the development of her little ones as they grow and learn new things.

Gloria comes before you with a request for support in order to make some improvements to her premises, of which the children will be the exclusive beneficiaries; she will adapt her home’s patio so that it will serve as a playground for the children.

loans.use: to adapt a patio to serve as a playground for children.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Él es Jesús un hombre de 55 años de edad que con su negocio de venta y cría de cerdos ha generado pro muchos años el sustento para su familia que la conforman dos hijos ya mayores de edad y su amada esposa.
Jesús es un hombre del campo, le gusta la vida tranquila y la serenidad y el alivio que le genera estar ejerciendo una actividad la cual realiza desde su hogar no la cambia por nada, pero como todo negocio pasa por tiempos difíciles, donde la falta de capital frena progreso y amenaza con cierre del negocio.
Con el apoyo de un crédito que se encuentra solicitando Jesús quiere comprar una cerda de cría la razón es que la que tenía falleció hace poco, el resto de capital lo invertirá en concentrado que es su alimento pues su negocio es vender cerdos engordados y esa es la mejor manera.
Apoya a este campesino que quiere seguir con la actividad que ha realizado pro largos años y con la que realmente se siente feliz.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 55-year-old man who is in the business of raising and selling pigs. For many years, he has been able to sustain his family, which consists of two grown children and his loving wife.

Jesús is a man from the country where he enjoys a peaceful and serene life. He finds relief from operating a business from home where he didn’t have to change anything. Like any business, he has endured difficult times when the lack of capital slowed down his progress and threatened to stop his operations.

With the support of this loan he is requesting, Jesús wants to buy a pig that he will raise since he had one that died a short time ago. The rest of the capital will be invested in concentrated feed for his business. This is the best way for him to fatten the pigs that he will sell.

Support this farmer who wants to continue the business he has operated for many years and that has brought him happiness.

loans.use: to buy a pig to raise and animal feed for all of his pigs.

loans.name: Yiseth Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es Yiseth una joven enérgica y activa de 21 años de edad, que mediante un préstamo quiere Reiniciar su negocio de venta de mercancía que paro por el nacimiento de su hijo y hoy ya que tiene dos años de edad puede seguir con su labor para generar recursos pues su pareja la abandono y quedo como madre a cargo de su bebe.
Ella con el préstamo pretende comprar, surtido de ropa para hombre y dama, accesorios como lo son relojes, manillas, pulseras y anillos, pijamas y sandalias.
Por eso pide muy encarecidamente una ayuda su objetivo es ser suficiente para mantener su hijo, tiene temor ella viene de familia humilde, solo le queda trabajar, se compromete a pagar puntual, y un compromiso de estudiar y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
This is Yiseth, an energetic and active young lady 21 years of age. Through a loan she wants to reboot her business selling commodities which ceased after the birth of her son. He is now two years old which allows her to pursue work to generate income. Her partner left the business to become a full time mother. 

With the loan she intends to purchase an assortment of clothing for men and women, accessories such as: watches, cuffs, bracelets, rings; as well as pajamas and sandals. For this she earnestly asks for some help. Her objective is to be self-sufficient enough to raise her son. She comes from a family of humble means and is afraid. She only wants to remain working and is committed to repaying punctually and to study and move her business forward.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of clothing for men and women, accessories such as: watches, cuffs, bracelets, rings; as well as pajamas and sandals

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es: Ana de 66 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, desde hace 4 años posee una librería ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieta, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra mas de cuadernos, lapiceros, colores, resmas de papel bond, papel de regalo, entre otras cosas, y así poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos  y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 66, is a very hardworking, responsible woman.  She has had a bookstore in her place of residence for four years, and she has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells. 

With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some of her home’s expenses.  Ana lives in her own house with her daughter and her granddaughter. 

She is requesting another loan for the purchase of more notebooks, pencils, crayons, reams of bond paper, and gift wrapping paper, among other items. In this way, she can continue with her sales in order to have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more notebooks, pencils, crayons, reams of bond paper, and gift-wrapping paper, among other items.

loans.name: Carlos Oscar

texts.es: Carlos de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el posee desde hace 23 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y como logra salir adelante junto con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 55 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and son. For the past 23 years, he has managed a store at his place of residence. He has many customers because of the good prices and the variety of products that he sells. With the income he generates from his sales, Carlos has been able to move forward with his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, and other products. This will enable him to have more income so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted books to add to her stock and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, paint, corrugated metal sheeting, and other materials to carry out repairs to her house.

loans.name: Luisa Liveth

texts.es:
Luisa es una madre de familia cabeza de hogar, se encuentra a cargo de 2 hijas de 14 y 12 años de edad, separada actualmente de su pareja y con problemas financieros, pero a pesar de todo siempre tiene un motivo para sonreír y para salir de las adversidades las cuales son sus hijas esas dos criaturas que sacan lo mejor de ella y la motivan a salir adelante y demostrar cada día que es una gran mujer. 
Luisa con su venta de alimentos genera los recursos para mantenerse, aunque le falta capital, decoración, insumos siempre tiene la creatividad y saca provecho de los recursos que tiene a la mano, como en la foto, su hogar lo decora con periódico para evitar que el material del cual está hecho al casa llegue a caer en alimentos. 
Luisa quiere una ayuda y es que le faltan algunos insumos y activos para seguir desarrollando su actividad o por lo menos disminuir los costó y tiempos de operación, por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar los siguientes insumos:
Comprar utensilios, comprar una mesa, un horno e insumos para desarrollar sus actividades.
texts.en:
Luisa a mother who heads her household. She is in charge of two daughters. who are 12 and 14 years old. 

She's separated from her partner right now and has financial problems, but in spite of all this, she's inspired to smile and move beyond the adversities. Her daughters are two creatures that bring out the best in her and motivate her to get ahead, and show everyday that she is a great woman.

Luisa earns income to support herself through selling food. Though she lacks capital, decor and inputs, she always has the creativity and takes advantage of the resources she has at hand. As in the photo, she decorates her home with newspaper to prevent the material it's made of from falling into the food.

Luisa wants help because she lacks some inputs and assets to continue developing her activity, or at least decrease the cost and operation time. As a result, she wants to buy the following inputs: utensils, a table, an oven and inputs to develop her activities.

loans.use: to buy utensils, a table, an oven and inputs to develop her activities.

loans.name: Nsuura 1 Savings And Credit Group

texts.en: Alfred is a member of Nsuura 1 savings and credit group, whose members guarantee each other's payments in order to access a loan. He is a hardworking man with four children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he works as a retailer, sells maize and cassava flour, and does coffee farming. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital that hinders the progress of his business. His goal is to have adequate capital for his businesses and a healthy family. Alfred has requested a loan to buy maize flour and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en: The  Grade  group will begin its forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. It is made up of four members and is led by Kweku. The businesses that they own focus on polyethylene products, insecticide spray, smoked fish, yam, fresh fish, onions and palm oil. The loan that they are taking out will benefit small business owners, of whom Kweku is one. He says that three years ago, he joined ID-Ghana at the invitation of a promoter from the institution who went to visit him at his house. Currently he sells polyethylene products and insecticide sprays. He began this business when he noticed a lack of these products in his zone, and decided to invest some money in entering this field. The loan that he has requested will increase his capital (to buy polyethylene products and insecticide sprays in bulk) that he will get from wholesalers in the city of Accra and later sell from door to door. This type of work allows him to generate income to support himself since he is single and has no children. When asked what he likes about ID-Ghana, he said the health program and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy polyethene products and insecticide sprays in bulk.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 52 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Pacita has borrowed and repaid six prior loans from NWTF, and has been running her general store for six years. She also earns an income from raising pigs. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 23-year-old hardworking woman who has 2 children.

She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Sonia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Sonia has requested a loan amount of 50,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en:
Elmir is 31 years old and married with a daughter. His wife is a teacher. Elmir’s daughter is a talented girl who plays the piano and goes to school. In the future, she wants to be a musician. Elmir is a sports trainer who rents an area for his business. He and his family live in the Absheron region, but since he was 22 years old they have been internally displaced persons (IDP) who are originally from Füzuli city.
