Elmir is requesting a 1,100 AZN loan through Komak company to buy a fitness machine and expand his business. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for help. In the future, Elmir wants to help his daughter get an education.

loans.use: to buy a fitness machine and expand his business

loans.name: Huayocari Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HUAYOCARI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabriela ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "HUAYOCARI" communal bank. This bank is located in the Huayllabamba district, which is part of the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

This member is Señora Gabriela. She lives with her partner, is 34 years old, and has two children. She works in her grain-sales business, selling corn, wheat, and quinoa, from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for four years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her grains. She is requesting the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The member who is added on to the group photo had his picture taken after the meeting; he requested permission for work reasons.

The other members earn their livings selling animals, selling grain, running a grocery store, and selling food.
	
The member thanks those who are taking part in her dream via this means and she promises to repay her loan according to the established timetable.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Norjane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norjane works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Norjane has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

Norjane is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as pants, shorts, blouses, and other items to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shorts, blouses, and other items

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Emerita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods, such as pants, curtains, blankets, etc., to sell.

Emerita has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Emerita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods, such as pants, curtains, blankets, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is 61 years old, married, and has two children.

Generosa works hard to provide for her family. For the past seven years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines. Additionally, she raises chickens to supplement her income.  

Generosa is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as candy, canned goods, biscuits, cereals, coffee, and sugar, to sell in her store.  In the past, Generosa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. 

Generosa aspires to save enough to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries including candy, canned goods, biscuits, cereals, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve, 52, is a married woman who has five children, three of whom currently attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For the past six years, Eve has operated a business where she buys and sells used clothing in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell.

In the future, Eve would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 37 years old and earns a living by farrming in the mountainous Nandi Hills region. She has been married for 10 years to her husband Jacob and she has five children aged between 5 and 11. After getting married, Hellen immediately started to make use of her husband's thirteen-acre farm to grow crops (e.g., tea) and raise animals (cattle). Hellen is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies that will allow her to grow tea more easily and faster. Besides tea farming, Hellen also keeps five dairy cows and nine heads of poultry. The additional income generated by this investment will allow her to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is a 40-year-old man who is married with six children. All of his children are in school. Lauben comes from Kakuuto, Musiza, in the Kamwenge district. He works fattening cattle and buys them, feeds them for about three months, and sells them off with a huge profit. Lauben has managed to earn a living to provide the best for his family. 

Lauben is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan to help him buy more cattle for fattening. He will use the rest of his loan to buy an extra piece of land to increase his grazing land for his cattle. In the future, Lauben hopes to construct a permanent home for his family. He appreciates the zeal of lenders to fight poverty.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rogelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Rogelio es un hombre con muchos alientos y ganas de salir adelante, sus 65 años de edad no son un impedimento para trabajar duro con esmero por un mejor futuro no solo para él si no para dos de sus tres hijos que aún son menores de edad ya que tiene uno de 27 años, uno de 18 y otro de 8 años de edad, inicio su negocio por necesidad económica ya que es muy realista y sabe que a su edad muy difícilmente lo van a emplear y quedarse en la casa sin hacer nada no es una opción para él.
Rogelio quiere pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener sostenibilidad del negocio y porque no montar tiendas en diferentes sectores, brindando empleo.
Solicita un préstamo pequeño para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como frijoles, huevos, mantequilla, arepas, sal, azúcar, pastas, quesito, leche, refrescos, papa, productos de mucho movimiento en su tienda.
Vale la pena apoyar e incentivar a personas como Rogelio que prefieren dar toda su vida al trabajo a quedarse en casa sin hacer nada, trabaja porque sus hijos merecen lo mejor de él.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a man with many dreams and aspirations. At 65 years old, he is still working with the hopes not only for a better future for himself, but for two of his children who are still minors. His oldest child is 27 years old, but his youngest are 18 and 8 years old.

He began his business out of necessity because he is a realist and knows that at his age it will be very difficult to find employment and staying at home not working is not an option for him.

Rogelio wants to pay for his children's education, improve his living conditions and provide stability as well as employment for others.

He is asking for a small loan in order to purchase supplies for his grocery store like beans, eggs, butter, arepas, salt, sugar, pasta, cheese, milk, sodas, potatoes and other in demand products.

It is worth mentioning the initiative of people like Rogelio who prefer to dedicate their life to their work instead of staying at home and not doing anything. He works because his children deserve the best.

loans.use: purchase supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 43-year-old married lady and the mother of eight children. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the help of her husband (who is also shown in the photo).  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Haleema makes enough profit to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, salt, flour, etc. from the market. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Haleema wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, salt, flour, etc. from the market.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 38 years old. She lives with her sister and pensioner parents in the Kutaisi District. The family's only source of income s her sister's monthly salary.  Her sister works as a nurse at a local kindergarten. 

Nino is unemployed despite having a higher education. She has a great desire to start her own business. The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. Nino will use these funds to open a stationery shop, where she will also work as the salesperson. The Start Up program will be a great help for Nino as she will able to generate her own income and help her family.

loans.use: to open a stationery shop

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр молодой житель города Курган-Тюбе. Ему 33 года. Он женат и не имеет детей. Жена дома занимается шитьем. Его брат находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Бахтиёр ответственный и самостоятельный человек. Бахтиер хочет трудиться сам и зарабатывать своим трудам, поэтому он собирается начать свой бизнес. Он берет кредит, и за счет кредита он привезет фруктов и овощей. Бахтиёр будет заниматься продажей на рынке. С Вашей помощью он станет успешным и хорошим бизнесменом. Бахтиёр надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a young resident of the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 33 and married with no children. His wife works at home as a seamstress and his brother is working in Russia. 

Bahtiyor is a responsible and independent person who wants to work hard and earn a living from his effort; therefore, he is preparing to start his own business. He is taking out a loan to bring in fruits and vegetables, which he will sell at the market. With your help he will become a good and successful businessman. He is hoping for your assistance.

loans.use: to purchase and ship fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 59 years old and married with three children.

Justina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Justina has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Justina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Eugenia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eugenia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Eugenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 31-year-old married lady with two children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She owns a salon a business she started with the hope of getting money and looking after her family. She is working towards building a house and enlarging her business to new areas.

She is acquiring a loan facility to buy braids and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy braids and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing netting for her fishing/fish vending business.

Josephine has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising goats.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing netting for her business.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a 32-year-old married lady with four children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She owns a bar business she started with the hope of employing herself. She is very hardworking and desires to educate all her children to higher levels of learning.

She needs a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Ricklin

texts.en: Ricklin is a 23-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop. She is a very hard working lady with a goal of buying land to build rental houses that will boost her income. She needs a loan to buy beers, soap, salt, sugar and other goods to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy beers, soap, salt, sugar and other goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new style clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 51-year-old married woman who has been doing business purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of two children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers.

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Manolita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Manolita has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Manolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is married with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has run a general store since 1996. He also practices farming, growing crops such as maize, beans, rice and others to get additional income. Charles has a dream of educating his children to university level. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Charles wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Evelyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business. She has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Amado De Jesus

texts.es:
Amado desde el año 1995 inicio con un negocio de panadería el cual aprendió de su hermano, lo trabaja todos los días de la semana con una intensidad de 8 a 10 horas, desde que trabajaba con su hermano le apasiono la panadería y al ir juntando recursos decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio y hoy año 2015 sigue en pie y perseverando en el tiempo.
Amado aparte de su panadería tiene otras responsabilidades es padre de 3 hijos  dos hombres y una dama, lo más hermoso de este negocio es que en su panadería da empleo a 7 personas y sigue proyectándose para crecer tener otros locales y brindar empleo.
 Amado se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones a su negocio, la más urgente es revocar y embaldosar el piso no solo pro estética si no por norma sanitaría, por ello es de urgencia el crédito pues con el pago de nómina no le queda mucho capital.
texts.en:
Amado started a bakery business in 1995, which he learned from his brother. He works every day of the week with an intensity of 8 to 10 hours. Ever since he worked with his brother, baking has inspired him and after getting the resources together he decided to become independent and start his own business. Today, in the year 2015, he continues on his feet and persevering through time. 

Amado, aside from his bakery, has other responsibilities as the father of three children, two boys and one girl. 

The most beautiful thing about this business is that in his bakery he gives employment to seven people and he continues with plans to grow and have other locations and provide employment. 

Amado finds himself requesting a loan to make some adaptations to his business, the most urgent is to plaster and tile the floor, not only for esthetics but also for health standards. For that reason the loan is urgent since with the payment of payroll he is not left with much capital.

loans.use: to plaster and tile the floor of his business.

loans.name: Carlos Jenner

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores de este distrito se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 4 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. A la vez cuenta con una segunda mototaxi de su propiedad la cual alquila recibiendo ingresos diarios por el alquiler de este vehículo. El préstamo será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de sus vehículos ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Carlos espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 27 years old and has a live-in partner. He resides in the Buenos Aires district, which is located in Morropón province, within the Piura region of the northern coast of Peru. Life in his community is quiet and its residents make a living from trading and small livestock.

Carlos makes a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has four years of experience and good references from district residents. Carlos owns a second motorcycle taxi, which he rents by the day. He is requesting a loan to perform repairs and maintenance of his vehicles, which are currently in poor condition. Carlos hopes that the loan will enable him to provide better service to his customers and hence increase his income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance of his vehicles, which are currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Grace works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. 

Grace is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is a married woman with two children. She is 28 years old and one of her children is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business retailing rice in the Philippines. 

Herminda has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years, and earns additional income from meat vending and selling roasted whole pig.

Miraflor is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe de 68  años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 25  años a su negocio del transporte de materiales de construcción, entre otros.
Don Felipe también mantiene contratos con una empresa privada desde hace 20 años el tiene 2 camiones de carga pesada laborando para estas empresas de forma permanente,  vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al  sur de Honduras, el es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de llantas para uno de sus vehículos que mantiene en su casa para transportar materiales,  con este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando  con Prisma.
Su sueño es  hacer crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Enero del  2015
texts.en:
Felipe, 68, lives with his wife in his own house.  For 25 years, he has had a business transporting construction materials, among other items, and he has also maintained contracts with private companies for more than 20 years; he has two heavy freight trucks continuously working for these companies.

He lives in a village near San Lorenzo in Southern Honduras, and he is an enterprising man who wants to improve his quality of life.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of tires for one of his vehicles that he keeps at his house for transporting materials.  He hopes to improve his earnings and his quality of life with this loan, and he wants to keep working as a client with Prisma.

His dream is to grow his business and improve his quality of life along with his family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras—January, 2015

loans.use: to purchase tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de lubricantes y accesorios de vehículo.
Ella es alegre, feliz, emprendedora, independiente, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ un área popular, abarrotada de comercio; restaurantes, librerías, farmacias, tiendas de barrio y todo tipo de comercio se encuentran lado a lado, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 9-18 grados centígrados.
Laura es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus padres que tienen una casa construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de lubricantes y accesorios para vehículos, como; aceites, líquido para frenos, limpiaparabrisas, carpa para auto y otros. “trabajo desde muy pequeña, no pude continuar la escuela por motivos laborales, actualmente cuento con un negocio próspero porque donde estoy ubicada existen muchos talleres automotores y vienen constantemente a comprar lubricantes…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su tienda y aumentar la cantidad de artículos que vende porque su negocio está bien ubicado, ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Laura solicita un préstamo para la compra de lubricantes y accesorios para automóvil para ofertar mayor variedad y mejorar sus ventas
texts.en:
Laura is a young 21-year-old woman who is single and without children. Her business is the sale of vehicle lubricants and accessories. She is cheerful, happy, entrepreneurial, independent, has a good attitude, is responsible, and hardworking. 

She carries out her business in the ‘Max Paredes' zone, a popular area crowded with business; restaurants, bookstores, pharmacies, neighborhood stores, and all types of businesses can be found side by side. It is a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 9-18 degrees Celsius. 

Laura has dark complexion, long black hair that she ties back, dark eyes, and a thin physique. Her primary language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for her business. She shares her life with her parents. They have a house made of brick with a corrugated iron roof that has potable water, electricity, gas, and a sewage system.

Her business is the sale of vehicle lubricants and accessories such as oil, brake fluid, windshield wipers, car tents, and other things. “I have worked since I was very small. I couldn’t continue school because of work reasons. Now I have a thriving business because there are many automotive shops where I am located and they come constantly to buy lubricants…” she says. 

Her dream is to expand her store and increase the quantity of items that she sells because her store is well located. She wishes to buy merchandise for her business. This is the first sequence of loans in four years with the institution that she is doing independently. For those reasons, Laura requests a loan to buy automotive lubricants and accessories to offer better variety and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy automotive lubricants and accessories to offer better variety and improve her sales.

loans.name: Jose Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel Jesús tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, desde hace varios años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel Jesus is 49 years old and married. He has two children and lives with his family in the district of Oyotun, a rural district where residents make a living through agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is located in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Jose makes a living selling basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, and bean soup. He has many years of business experience and very good personal and professional references within his community. Jose runs his business from his home. He is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to stock his business and thus increase his family's income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Willan

texts.es:
Willan tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, realiza esta actividad desde hace 6 años contando con experiencia en este negocio, tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de la zona. El crédito será para incrementar su plantación de caña de azúcar destinada a la destilación de aguardiente, con esto Willan espera ofrecer mayor cantidad de producto a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Willan is 34 years old and lives with his spouse and youngest child in the Pucará district, which is located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru. The main areas of economic activity within this district are agriculture, trade, and the raising of livestock.

Willan makes a living through the distillation of firewater. He has six years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references from local residents. Willan is requesting a loan to expand his sugarcane plantation, which is intended for the distillation of firewater. He intends to offer a larger quantity of product to his customers in order to generate a higher income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to expand his sugarcane plantation, which is intended for the distillation of firewater.

loans.name: Cherel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cherel works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Cherel is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Cherel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en: Gaudencia works hard to support her family. Gaudencia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Gaudencia requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Gaudencia has been in this business for 20 years now. Gaudencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 40 years old and married with four children. Bernadette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  Bernadette has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. Bernadette aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pacoba Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Pacoba Poty, está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento, un lugar eminentemente rural, con escaso medio de acceso.
La Sra. Lidia,  es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y animales de corral, con este trabajo desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las reuniones de capacitaciones ir mejorando cada día, y seguir  procurando  para su familia un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para producción de quesos y animales para la cría, así poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group "Pacoba Poty" is in its second cycle of the women's committee program. This group is in the city of Curuguaty, an area in development, an eminently rural place lacking much access.

Lidia, one of the members of the group, sells cheese and farm animals. She derives great satisfaction from her work and through the training courses is improving every day and continues to provide her family with a brighter future.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to produce cheese and buy animals for breeding, so she can continue building her business and give her family everything it needs.

loans.use: buy ingredients for cheese production and animals for breeding.

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es: Marianela de 36 años de edad es separada con 3 hijos dependientes. Ella pertenece al grupo “Quiere al niño” conformado por 07 socios responsables. Marianela es una mujer emprendedora que con esfuerzo saca a sus hijos adelante. Se dedica a trabajar en el procesamiento de ají hace aproximadamente 6 años. Su mayor anhelo es de poder tener su negocio propio de ropa. Solicitó el crédito para capital de su propio negocio. El grupo “Quiere al niño” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Marianela es la primera  del lado izquierdo, ella se encuentra  sentada, viste polo celeste y pantalón verde.
texts.en:
Marianela, 36, is separated with three dependent children. She belongs to the group, “Quiere al Niño” [“Love the Child”], composed of seven responsible members. Marianela is an enterprising woman who works hard in order to provide for her children.  She has worked processing peppers for approximately six years.

Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own clothing business, and she has requested the loan in order to have capital for it. 

The “Quiere al Niño” Group thanks the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Marianela is the first lady on the left; she is wearing a sky-blue polo shirt and green pants.

loans.use: to have capital for her own business.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en: Sebastian is 35 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a livestock-selling business for 10 years. He will be using the loan to purchase more cattle and hopes this will help him to sell more cattle to his customers and meet the high demand in the area. His hopes and dreams for the future are to pay school fees for his children and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale and meet his customers' high demand of cattle in the area.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 52 years old with four children. Elvira personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 7,000 for the purchase of new nets.  

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 33 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a retail shop business for the last five years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase stock of retail goods e.g. cooking fat, flour, and soft drinks to sell to her customers, and hopes this will help her to pay her children's school fees.


Hellen's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase stock of retail goods e.g. cooking fat, flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta en el exterior de un mercado de su distrito, es conocida en por la labor que realiza, su hija le apoya en esta labor. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecino. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and lives with her daughter in the district of Cayaltí, located in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. The community's main economic activities are agriculture, trade, and the raising of livestock.

María makes a living selling fruit outside of a local market. She is well-known in this role and is aided by her daughter. María has experience in this business and good personal and professional references from her neighbors. She is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of fruits to offer to her customers and hence be able to increase her family's income and improve their family of life.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fruits to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, 54, is a smallholder mixed farmer based in North Rift, Kenya. Annah has been married to Matayo for over 30 years and they have 6 children together. Maintaining a family of 6 children can be challenging and so it requires parents who are ready to go an extra mile to provide and support the family unit. 

When Annah got married, she made use of her husband's 3-acre land to start a small rural farm enterprise. Today, the farm is covered in trees, crops and grass (for her dairy cows). Annah's most recent business move was to venture into the cereal trade where the demand for ugali, Kenya's staple food made out of cereal grains, maintains high market prices. 

Your loan investment in Annah will raise her family's net income which will result in better living. Adding cereals into her product portfolio will not only grow her business but also bring about diversity and better risk management.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Lorgina

texts.en:
Lorgina is 35 years old and has eight children. She is married and seven of her children are currently in school.

Lorgina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorgina has been farming vegetable for 8 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lorgina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 24 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, She works very hard to provide for her family.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kurinerio

texts.en:
Kurinerio is a 36-year-old man, married with four children. He comes from Nyabihoko, in Kamwenge district.

Kurinerio deals in produce with capital UGX 1,000,000 as his main source of income, which he uses to take care of his family. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. He wants to use this money to buy more coffee to sell since it is now the season for coffee harvesting. He will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children. His major challenge is inadequate capital and poor transport means to carry his produce from the field to his store.

Despite these challenges, he is determined to take his business to another level and is working hard to maintain the relationship between Ugafode and the Kiva lenders. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Angela es una bella joven de 26 años de edad soltera y buscando su pareja ideal la cual ha ido formalizando y surtiendo un negocio que es un miscelánea, donde oferta productos de papelería y de uso personal como algodones, alcohol antiséptico, copos para los oídos, gel para peinar, cremas de manos entre otros. 
La razón que lleva a Angela a solicitarles una ayuda, comprometiéndose a pagar muy puntualmente la pueden observar en la foto, como inicio su negocio hace poco sus estanterías están muy vacías, necesita capital para abastecer su negocio de productos, por ello con un préstamo quiere comprar los productos anteriormente descritos, y frituras de papas en empaques.
Con este apoyo su negocio florecerá será más atractivo y sus ventas aumentaran considerablemente.
texts.en:
Angela is a beautiful, 26-year-old, single woman who is looking for her ideal partner.

She has set up a retail business where she offers stationery and personal use products such as cotton, rubbing alcohol, cotton swabs, styling gel and hand creams among other things.

She has recently started her business and, as you can see in the picture, her shelves are quite empty. She needs to stock her business. That is what drove Angela to ask lenders for economical help, committing to pay back promptly. She will use the loan to buy the products previously mentioned and also bags of potato chips.

With this help her business will flourish, it will be more attractive and her sales will increase considerably.

loans.use: to buy cotton, rubbing alcohol, cotton swabs, styling gel and hand creams among other things.

loans.name: Isareri

texts.en: Isareri lives in Nyakanyoga, Kitagwenda in Kamwenge distict. He is 45 years old and married, with seven children who are all in school. Isareri will be accessing a second funding with Kiva this cycle. He appreciates the previous support because with it his agricultural land increased. Isareri deals in agricultural produce as his main source of income. He supports this with alcohol brewing where he earns income to provide for his family and also send his children to good schools. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him buy more stock and raw materials to use in alcohol brewing. He will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children. His major challenge is inadequate capital to invest in his business. Isareri is a very honest and hard working man.

loans.use: To buy ripe bananas for making local brew

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 52-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas and maize. He also works as a driver earning a monthly salary. He is faced with challenges of little capital. That hinders the progress of his business. Besides that, he hopes to have a good homestead and educate all his children to higher levels of learning. He needs a loan to buy construction materials for his residential house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his residential house.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 37-year-old lady. She has been stitching clothes for one year. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues. In this way she will be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the work of hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she earns enough through her skill to meet the expenses of her family.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, stones, etc. for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, stones, etc.

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is a carver who specializes in wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and hire more carvers at his workshop. Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: Wayan's father began teaching him to sculpt when he was a boy. "Balinese woodcarving touches me very deeply. I have learned a variety of arts in Bali, such as gamelan dance, but carving a piece of wood gives me an incomparable sensation," he says. "After I finished school, I studied further because I needed more experience, and the tools and material I needed were beyond my financial reach. Exploring the abstract world refreshes my mind in creating new carvings." "I am grateful for the support that you have given me in the past, and would like to take out a new loan so that I can increase my inventory and hire more carvers to work with me. Thank you!" Use the link below to view Wayan's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/878

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and hire more carvers at his workshop

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Wahyu is an artisan from Bali who specializes in beaded batik handbags and totes. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including batik fabric and beads, as well as a sewing machine for her workshop. Wahyu has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story: Wahyu works in Java's legendary batik art. "I'm always keen to learn new things and new techniques. My family taught me that I must work hard to succeed in life. Now I am married and we have a lovely daughter. In my small batik workshop, I specialize in handbags, cushion covers and table runners, and add details with beads," she says. "I would like to say thank you very much for supporting me. This microcredit is very meaningful to me, as it will help me to craft more pieces and build up my inventory. I'm going to use it to buy raw materials and equipment, and also hire additional artisans for my workshop. Thank you for your help in lifting up my business." Use the link below to view Wahyu's beaded batik handbags and totes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8545

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including batik fabric and beads, as well as a sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of  drinking water to resell and a smaller sized poly tank for her home

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en: Maridel is a businesswoman from Tuburan. She is 37 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Maridel is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Maridel continues to look for better business opportunities; proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Livena

texts.en: Livena is driven by the passion of selling. At the age of 29, she is married and has two kids. The family lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philipiines. She runs a store to provide for her needs. Every day she patiently tends her store. Livena wants to expand her business. She recently applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where she became a member in 2012 in order to access insurance and financial assistance. Now she has borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en: Cleofe operates a motor transport business.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. In order to continue his business, he requested a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. He dreams of owning motor units and of being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Edgar Ramiro

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre de 49 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y trabaja como árbitro de futbol.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, de buena actitud, generoso, amable, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en diferentes ambientes deportivos de la ciudad, caracterizada por ser sede del Gobierno y de los Poderes Legislativos y Ejecutivos, tiene una variación altitudinal que oscila entre los 3250 metros sobre el nivel del mar y 4100 en sus puntos más altos, el clima en verano es templado y bastante lluvioso se registran neblinas por la noche y al amanecer, el clima de otoño es un poco frío y seco; y el invierno es seco y frío.
Edgar es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la realiza de manera independiente, vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado, su trabajo es el de árbitro de fútbol, labor poco valorada y no apreciada correctamente. Hace varios años inicio con la construcción de su hogar, la casa ya está terminada casi en su totalidad, sólo falta terminar el piso de toda la casa, motivo por el cual él realiza la solicitud de un préstamo. “con el esfuerzo de toda mi vida logré construir mi casa, ya se encuentra finalizada, sólo me falta el piso que actualmente es de tierra…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa para vivir de una manera confortable, él desea realizar el acabado del piso de su casa, para dejar de vivir sobre la tierra. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que viene construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Edgar solicita un préstamo para finalizar el acabado del piso de su casa y dejar de vivir sobre la tierra.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 49-year-old single man with no children who works as a soccer referee.

He has a good attitude, he is enterprising, independent, generous, kind, responsible and hardworking. He works as a referee on an itinerant basis, going to several different sports venues in La Paz. This job is undervalued and little appreciated.

The city of La Paz is known for being the seat of the government and the parliament. Its altitude varies from 3,250m above sea level and 4,100m at its highest points. In summer, the weather is mild and quite rainy, with mists at night and at dawn; in autumn, it is a bit cold and dry; and in winter, it is dry and cold.

Edgar is a thin man of dark complexion, he has short black hair and dark eyes. He speaks Aymara as his mother tongue with his family and Spanish because of his job and as part of the general culture.

He lives independently in a brick house with a tin roof, it has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system. The construction of the house began several years ago; now it is almost entirely finished, only the flooring remains to be finished. That is why he is requesting a loan.

'I managed to build my house with the efforts of a lifetime. It is nearly finished now, the only thing left is to finish the floor, which is currently dirt' he says. He wishes to bring the building of his house to an end so that he can live comfortably. He wants to complete the flooring to stop living on dirt.

This is the first loan cycle he requests from the institution in the 18 years he has been building his house.

It is for these reasons that Edgar is requesting a loan to complete the flooring of his home and stop living on dirt.

loans.use: to complete the flooring of his house and stop living on dirt.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.es:
Evelina tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 15 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de perfumes, colonias y ropa para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Evelina espera satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y sus ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Evelina, 32, has a partner and one child. She lives in her family's home, in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district goes by slowly, the inhabitants of this area work primarily in agriculture and animal husbandry.

She's been selling beauty products and clothing for women, men and children for 15 years and counts on a fixed clientele who give her good personal and work references. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, colognes and clothing for women, men and children to stock up her business. With this, Evelina hopes to satisfy the demands of her clients, which will increase her sales and result in an improved quality of life for her family.

loans.use: buy perfumes, colognes and clothing to stock up her business.

loans.name: Sasmita

texts.en:
Sasmita is 27 years old. A divorced woman, she lives with her parents and siblings in a small village of Khurda district, Odisha. She got separated from her husband before one year for her personal reason. 

Now she owns a grocery shop and earns 3,000 INR per month for her livelihood. She sells cereals, biscuits, sugar, spices, chocolates, soaps, detergents and other general items used in households. Her father helps in this business. 

She wants to renovate her grocery shop and also wants to add more products in her shop so she can cater to the needs of her customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to buy grocery items in bulk to resell, and she will also use a part of this loan for the renovation of her shop. She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy grocery items in bulk to resell and renovate the shop

loans.name: Ritafe

texts.en:
Ritafe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ritafe is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ritafe has a general store business in the Philippines. Ritafe requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Ritafe has been in this business for two years. Ritafe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tomasa Feliciana

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer de 54 años de edad, es casada vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos de las edades entre 22 y 30 años.
Tomasa es una señora muy trabajadora y perseverante, ella a pesar de su avanzada edad aun cuenta con mucha fuerza y voluntad  para trabajar, y para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo para el mantenimiento de su familia, desde hace 6 años Tomasa tuvo la iniciativa de poner una su tienda en su propia casa donde vende refrescos, recitos y otras cosas más, con esa mente positiva Tomasa comenzó su negocio y gracias a dios este negocio es bastante rentable para ella y su familia, entonces desde hace algunos meses Tomasa y su esposo han empezado a construir su casa, pero con los precios altos que ahora tienen los materiales de construcción ellos ya no tienen la capacidad de capital para terminar la construcción de su casa, pero para Tomasa es muy importante finalizar la construcción de la vivienda y ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizará para comparar, cemento,  bloc, cal arena y piedrín.
Tomasa aspira a este préstamo para que termine de construir su casa este año y seguir haciendo mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a married 54-year-old woman. She lives with her husband in the community of Sololá and has five children between 22 and 30 years of age. Tomasa is a hardworking and persistent woman; despite her advanced age, she has a lot of strength and willingness to work, to generate income and to help her husband to support their family. 

For six years, Tomasa has been running a store from her own home where she sells soft drinks, snacks, and other items. She established her business with a positive mindset and, thankfully, the business is fairly profitable for her and her family. Because of this, she and her husband begun to build their own home. However, because of the recent increases in the price of building materials they no longer have enough funds to finish the construction, a project of great importance to Tomasa. Hence, she is requesting a loan to purchase blocks, lime, sand, and gravel. Tomasa hopes to receive this loan so that she may finish her home this year and continue performing home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, lime, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fishing-related products to resell them at the market.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Today, Uber car services provide a very cost-effective method of transportation for many people, and are an alternative to conventional taxi companies. However, long before Uber became widespread, Julio recognized the advantage of providing cheaper transportation services to his community.  Fourteen years ago, he started his own company as a means of earning money on a self-controlled schedule. 

Originally, from the Dominican Republic, Julio is currently an Uber driver. He lives with his son, and supports all his three children. Always looking for ways to improve his business, Julio currently struggles with the need to purchase a new car, while simultaneously lacking the working capital to do so. 

This loan will enable him to buy a new car and improve the quality and scope of his services. In the future, he hopes to use profits generated from this investment to purchase  more than one car, and be able to grow his business and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his ridesharing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy new and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a commercial lawn mower to sustain his environmentally conscious landscaping business

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Music is a key component of social gatherings and venues with its ability to create an enjoyable environment for its listeners. Fourteen years ago, Jonathan committed himself to helping others enjoy themselves by pursuing a career that he, himself, enjoyed. He started his own DJ business because he loved both playing music and “knowing that people had the time of their lives after I am done playing music.” 

Originally from Guatemala, Jonathan has lived in the U.S. for 28 years. He works independently, and lives with his wife and four kids. His business allows him to support his family and has allowed him to purchase a home.

However, the slow economic activity of 2007-2009 took a toll his business. He hopes to use this loan to purchase more equipment and expand the services of his DJ-ing company to include karaoke. This will enable him to get more business and increase profits. In the future, he wants to be a full-time DJ and grow his business so that his kids can join him.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and expand the services of his music services company

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Several years ago, Adam decided to follow an enjoyable hobby, and started a clothing printing business out of his garage. Since then, it has grown into a sustainable business than allows him to support his wife and kids. 

Adam grew up in Kansas City and went to college in Missouri. One of his college friends convinced him to move to Hawaii after college, and Oahu is the current location of his successful screen printing business, where he provides printed shirts for clothing lines, construction crews, restaurants, schools, churches, and many others.

However, he is in need of improved equipment. With his current equipment, Adam’s business is greatly limited in the services it can provide. When he gets large orders, it pushes back all his other print jobs. This loan will allow him to upgrade his equipment and have working capital in the transition period. He projects his business will double sales in the next year with the help of this loan and from growing demand for his services. In the future, he hopes to start an in-house clothing line.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and printing supplies until cash flow increases from a new printing investment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to resell in father away zones.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Poty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, cada una de las integrantes pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones, todas ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nelly, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando su vida a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la costura lucha para poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pueden tener y evitar que pase por necesidades como las que ella tuvieron que pasar.
La Sra. Nelly  pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Encarnación. Each member makes their best efforts to be able to give their family a dignified life without deprivation, and all of them form part of the programme to eliminate poverty.

One of the members is Nelly, who in her last survey scored a level of poverty within level three, which is to say that she has been improving her life through effort and continued working. Through sewing she strives to give her family everything they could not have and avoids them having unmet needs like those she had to live with.

Nelly is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying material, thread, buttons and other items, to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opporunity she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, buttons and other items.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre soltero de 48 años de edad, vive solo y no tiene hijos su pasatiempo radica en su negocio el cual es la venta de suvenires, pues en este negocio interactuar con personas de otras nacionalidades, tiene la experiencia de conocer personas con diferentes pensamiento y en pocas palabras le apasiona y le gusto lo que hace. 
Su mercancía son productos muy típicos de la región antioqueña como lo son alpargatas, sombreros, monederos, mochilas entro otros objetos. 
Dicha actividad la lleva realizando desde el año 1968 siendo su principal objetivo mantener su negocio y seguir juntando dinero para comprar una vivienda propia.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cuero un elemento primordial en la fabricación de sus objetos.
texts.en:
Julio is a single, 48 year old man.  He lives alone and does not have any children.  He spends his time in his business where he makes souvenirs.  Through his business, he is able to interact with people of other nationalities and get to know people with different points of view.  In simple terms, he is passionate about and loves what he does.  He makes products that are typical of the Antioqueña region, such as, sandals, hats, purses and backpacks among other items.  He has worked in this field since 1968, and his primary objective is to keep his business going and continue saving money in order to purchase his own home.  

He is seeking a loan to purchase leather, an essential element in making his products.

loans.use: purchase leather, which is an essential element in making his products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, disposable utensils, plates, and cups; corn tortillas, sausages, salad, salsa, napkins, soft drinks, potatoes, and bacon, among other things.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado él tiene 50 años  de edad vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad de Sololá.
Enrique es ejemplo de superación y dedicación gracias a que se esmera de sol a sol en el cultivo sembrando una diversidad de verduras a logrado la prosperidad de su hogar, Enrique está muy agradecido por el préstamo anterior  porque gracias a eso el logro cultivar y mejorar sus ingresos  el ahora su condición de vida ha mejorado, pero ahora enrique se ve a la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda porque la casa donde él vive se encuentra ya en mal estado pero una de las limitaciones que Enrique tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder hacerlos entonces el nuevamente solicita un  préstamo de Q.9000.00 que lo utilizara para comprar bloc, cemento, puertas.
El anhelo de Enrique es poder contar con este nuevo préstamo para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor vivienda y construirle a todos sus hijos una casa.
texts.en:
Enrique is a very hard working and dedicated man. He is 50 years old. He live with his wife in Sololá.
Enrique is an example of perseverance and dedication since he works from dawn to dusk planting a variety of vegetables. He is very grateful for the previous loan because thanks to the loan he was able to improve his earnings. His living conditions have improved but now Enrique needs to improve his home because the house where he lives is in a bad state. One of the limitations that Enrique has is that he does not have enough money to make the improvements. He is again requesting Q.9000.00 to purchase bricks, cement and doors. Enrique's wish is to have this new loan give his family a better home and to build all of his children a home.

loans.use: purchase brick, cement and doors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hay, store it for a time, and then resell it later.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 29 years old, married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. 

She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional feed

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 54, a married woman in Buenavista, she runs a store that primarily supports the family. Every day, she never gets tired tending her store. 

Petra is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife works hard to support her family. Marife is married and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Marife requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Marife has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Marife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Bevelyn is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bevelyn has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from firewood vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Binge

texts.en:
Binge is 32 years old and has three children. Binge is married and has three children who are in school.

Binge is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Binge requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Binge has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Binge would like to save enough money so she is able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristine is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Cristine has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she is able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines for five years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Exaltacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell.

Exaltacion dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear items to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, a hardworking entrepreneur, has operated a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines for the past year. She earns additional income from buying and selling bread.


Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Flordeliza dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ilda Amparo

texts.es:
Ilda es una mujer perseverante, rebelde, independiente de 47 años de edad, vive en un hogar junto con su esposo y su hijo de 10 años, siempre le ha gustado generar sus propios recursos no depende de su marido es suficiente para mantener a su hijo y lo hace gracias a su cafetería que con esfuerzo y ahorro ha ido construyendo.
Ilda siempre busca los medios para que su negocio sea sostenible, la experiencia y bagaje que tiene en este mundo le han servido para sostenerse en el tiempo, gracias a este negocio puede pagar la educación de su hijo, y ahora quiere realizar unas reformas a su hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido en frituras en bolsa, bebidas e insumos para comidas como empanadas, tortas de carne y pasteles de pollo.
texts.en:
Ilda is a resolute, rebellious, and independent woman, age 47. She lives at home with her husband and her 10-year-old son. She has always liked generating her own resources independently of her husband, in order to have enough to support her son.  She does this by means of her café that she has built up with effort and savings.

Ilda is always looking for ways to keep her business going, and the experience and knowledge that she has in this world have served to keep her going over time.  Thanks to this business, she can pay for her son’s education, and now she wants to make some improvements to her home.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a supply of chips in bags, beverages, and supplies for foods such as empanadas, meat fritters, and chicken pies.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of chips in bags, beverages, and supplies for food such as empanadas, meat fritters, and chicken pies.

loans.name: Carlos Rodolfo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre desempleado de 49 años de edad,  separado de su esposa y con la responsabilidad de mantener 2 hijos lo conllevo  a acercarse alas instalaciones de Interactuar con el ánimo de solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercancía de ropa, la cual venderá familiares y amigos y en pueblos, buscando generar recursos para su sostenimiento y el de sus hijos que quedaron al cuidado de su madre. 
Con el crédito solicitado comprara camisas, camisetas, blusas, conjuntos deportivos, jeans, entre otros.
texts.en: Carlos is an unemployed 49 year old.  He is separated from his wife but being responsible for taking care of his two children, he decided to approach the Interactuar offices with the purpose of applying for a loan to purchase clothing that he can resell to family and friends as well as throughout villages.  He is hoping to earn an income so that he can support himself and his children who are being cared for by his mother.  With the loan, he will purchase shirts, t-shirts, blouses, athletic clothing, jeans, etc.

loans.use: purchase shirts, t-shirts, blouses, athletic clothing, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda es una mujer de 26 años de edad es casada vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad de las minas de san José Chacaya, Sololá.
Florinda es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a su trabajo, es una admirable mujer es porque a pesar de su escaso recursos ella a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ella está bastante satisfecha con el préstamo anterior porque gracias a este préstamo ella logro mejorar sus bordados típicos y sus clientes están satisfechos porque su calidad de costura a mejorado y con ello también  sus ingresos, ella cuenta que con las ganancias que genero logro comprar unas docenas de pollos y las está criando desde su casa y esto también le deja buenas ganancias, pero Florinda es una mujer que piensa en las necesidades de su hogar y desde hace algunos meses empezaron a construir su casa propia pero una de la limitaciones que Florinda tiene es que en este momento  ya no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para terminar de construir su casa entonces ella a tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de  cemento, bloc, arena y piedrín y así poder terminar de construir su casa
El sueño de Florinda  es poder terminar de construir su casa, y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Florinda is a 26 year old woman. She is married and lives with her husband in a community in the mines of San José Chacaya, Sololá. Florinda is a hardworking woman who is very devoted to her work.  She is very admirable because despite her few resources, she has been able to get her family ahead.  She is very satisfied with the previous loan she received because thanks to this loan, she was able to improve her embroidery and her customers are very satisfied because of the improved quality of her work. With these improvements in her work, she was also able to increase her earnings.  She states that with her earnings she was able to purchase a dozen chickens that she is raising in her home, which will also generate more income for her.

However, Florinda is a woman who also thinks of the needs of her household, and a few months ago they started to build a house.  Unfortunately, one of Florinda's problems at the moment is that they do not have enough money to finish building the house.  Therefore, she has made the decision of applying for a new loan that she will use to purchase cement, bricks, sand, and pebbles so that they can finish building their house.  Florinda's dream is to be able to finish building their home and continue supporting her children in school.

loans.use: purchase cement, bricks, sand, and pebbles.

loans.name: Nora Elena

texts.es:
Nora es un mujer de 37 años de edad, bella, con un futuro por delante, no tiene hijos tiene una pareja pero gracias a su tienda de abarrotes logro una independencia  económica en donde no necesita de alguien para comer.
