Rocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dunia Rosibel

texts.es: Dunia, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. Dunia tiene mas de cuatro años de dedicarse al comercio, tenia establecida una pulpería anteriormente con su clientela establecida, para la cual solicito un préstamo a ODEF y a KIVA, y logro buenas ventas y asi pudo pagar sin problemas, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes ya que en la comunidad en que vive es pequeña y ya existen viarios negocios de pulperías. Ella decidió cambiar de actividad de negocio, ahora vende mercadería la mayor parte es ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y ropa interior, y le está yendo muy bien ya que de este tipo de negocio no hay en su aldea. Esta solicitando otro préstamo por 8,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería como camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior y zapatos para la venta, esperando obtener mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta sigue siendo la de obtener buenos ingresos para un futuro darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Dunia, 27, is a single mother. She has a small son, she lives in a neighborhood which belongs to the municipality of Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. Dunia has been working in trade for more than four years. Previously, she had established a general store with her established clientele, for which she applied for a loan from ODEF and KIVA, and she achieved good sales and therefore could pay without problems. But her income isn't sufficient since in the community that she lives in is small and there are already various general store businesses. She decided to change her business activity. Now she sells merchandise. The majority is clothing for women, men and children and underwear. It's going very well for her since there is not this kind of business in her village.

She is applying for another loan for 8,000 lempiras to stock merchandise like to buy merchandise like shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear and shoes for selling. She is hoping to obtain better income for the sustenance of her family. Her goal continues being obtaining good income for a future to give education to her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear and shoes for selling.

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es:
Ana, de 68 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y su esposo es agricultor y tienen 2 hijos. 

Ana, inicio a trabajar a la edad de 12 años, toda su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo en la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes sembraban cultivos de maíz, frijol, sorgo y además criaban ganado.

Actualmente, cultiva 10,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y cría ganado, todo esto no podría realizarlo sola y es por eso que su esposo siempre está atento a prestarle su ayuda. De esta forma han logrado unir esfuerzos, con el objetivo de superarse. 

Gracias al préstamo Ana, lograra comprar ganado, de esta manera se contribuye a que pueda invertir en una de las dos actividades productivas que realiza y de esta forma obtener ingresos de la venta de estos. 

Ana, sueña con tener un terreno propio, donde realizar la siembra de sus cultivos y espera continuar trabajando y de esta forma cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Ana is 68 years old, married to a farmer, and the couple has two children. Her parents grew corn, beans, and sorghum, and also raised livestock. They also taught Ana to work when she was very young, and she began helping her parents on their farm when she was just 12. Ana has since spent her whole life working in agriculture.  

Ana now grows corn on 10,500 square meters and also raises livestock. She couldn't run the farm and manage the herd by herself, and her husband is therefore always prepared to help her. Ana and her husband have worked together so they can improve their lives. 

This loan will allow Ana to purchase livestock, investing in one of the two productive businesses that she operates, boosting her income from livestock sales. 

Ana would like to have her own land to grow her crops, and she hopes to keep working and achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 57, started farming 20 years ago when she got married to Hamman. Today, the couple is blessed with 7 brilliant children aged between 13 and 35. Elizabeth's 1.5 acre farmland has also shown significant growth from where it started two decades ago. The farm has 3 dairy cows, over 100 heads of poultry and various crop varieties. 

In a bid to improve her cattle's feed intake, Elizabeth is seeking a loan to purchase a hay chopping machine commonly known among farmers as a chaff cutter. Elizabeth will use the machine to cut grass and stalks into small even sizes that the animals will enjoy chewing. The added advantage is that the machine provides an elegant solution to feed mixing. 

Elizabeth is eager to acquire the machine as she is very certain that with improved water and feed consumption, milk production quantity is bound to shoot up. With your loan investment, you will make Elizabeth's ambitions come to life.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Diaz

texts.en:
Diaz comes from Kyandema, Kitagwenda in Kamwenge district. He is a single father but looks after his parents who are too old to care for themselves.

He deals in the sale of cereals as his main source of income. It is from this business that he has managed to earn a living. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to help him buy more stock of millet in addition to the one he has harvested.  This will increase his working capital. He is assured of clients. 

His major challenge is lack of enough capital to run his business. Despite these challenges, Diaz is a very honest and hard working man who has increased his client base. He is appreciative of the financial boost despite his low status.

loans.use: to purchase millet to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 61 years old and residing at Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a widow and blessed with 4 children who are all in their adult age.

She joined PMPC in 2009 to access the programs and services of the co-op. Recently, she applied for her seventh loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 for additional working capital. She will buy a variety of agricultural supplies to sell in her existing business, which serves the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of agricultural supplies to sell.

location.town: Liloy- Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 60 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with six adult age children. 

Lorna had made and sold her own snacks, like hot cake, banana cue and "Kamote" (sweet potato). She has had this business for 10 years. 

Lorna requested a loan to buy additional ingredients for her snack vending business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina always has enthusiasm when managing her farming activities, from which she earns an income that primarily supports her family. At the age of 43 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the Cooperative for the capital to support her farming activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and pay labor cost for land preparation to grow more produce. 

In the future, Marina wishes to see all her children with stable jobs and hopes to be able to expand and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and pay labor cost for land preparation.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su nuera y sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, pollos, frutas, huevos y demás productos para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. For a number of years, Maria has worked in food sales. Her business is located near her home in a high-transit area. With what she earns, Maria is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, vegetables, chicken, fruit, eggs and other products, in order to continue with her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, fruit, vegetables, eggs and other products.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 10 Y 3 años en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

La actividad a la que se dedica Adrian es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, su terreno está ubicado en el Caserio Patacón - Pomahauca, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en la zona, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto a un buen precio, lo que le generará mayores ganancias y mejoras en su calidad de vida y la de su famiia.
texts.en: Adrian is 30 years old. He lives in his own house, made of rustic material, with his wife and two children ages 10 and 3 years old. He lives in the district of Pomahuaca located in the Jaen province, department of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. The population in this district works primarily in agriculture and livestock. Adrian works in agriculture, specifically growing rice. His plot of land is located in the hamlet of Patacon, Pomahuaca. He has 8 years of experience in this field,  and he has good personal and professional references in the zone. This loan will be utilized in agricultural tasks, application, and implementation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his crop. Thus, he will get help in the physiological, morphological and production improvements needed in his crop, as well as obtain a timely harvest. He will consequently get a better production and a better quality product, which will make it easier to sell his product at a good price, resulting in better earnings and improvement in his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To utilize the loan in agricultural tasks, application and implementation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his crop.

loans.name: Jacinta De Jesús

texts.es:
El cantón del Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, en este lugar se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Palmar.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, el mayor es independiente y los menores estudian en  colegio y viven con ellos. El marido es chofer y comerciante.
Doña Jacinta se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  aves de corral (pollos, patos) en una pequeña granja en su casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras por su casa y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los chanchos en cambio los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 20 años dedicada a esta labor y les ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa, su esposo también le ayuda en las ventas.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cerdos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los cerdos. Está en el grupo de crédito hace cuatro años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a  gente del campo para crecer y así mantener a sus familias, sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen has a wealth of flora and fauna. One of the main sources of income in this area is the cultivation of bananas of the Barranganete variety. The members of the Communal Bank “El Palmar” meet in this place.

It is here that one can find Sra. Jacinta. She is 43 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. Her eldest child is independent and the younger children attend school and live at home. Her husband is a chauffeur and a merchant.

Doña Jacinta raises pigs and poultry (chickens and ducks) on a small farm at her house. On a seasonal basis, she buys a large number of chickens that she will raise over a two to three month period. After that time they are ready to be sold. The chickens are delivered to a few shops in her town, but she also sells them by the pound from her house. Some merchants will also come to her house to buy live chickens. The pigs she raises are butchered and the meat is sold by the pound. Jacinta has been in this business for 20 years and has done well since she has been able earn an income from home. Her husband also helps her with making sales.

This new loan will be used to buy pigs, feed, and medicines for both the chickens and pigs. Jacinta has been with her Communal Bank for four years and enjoys the help that her group gives to rural people so that they can grow and maintain their families. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and medicines for all of her animals.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Maricris works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Maricris is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maricris has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Bernadet

texts.en:
Bernadet is married and for seven years has had a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for them.

Bernadet requests a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothing to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 51 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Leonarda works very hard to provide for them.

Leonarda runs a general store in the Philippines and has three years of experience. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara, de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta primer grado, es madre soltera, solo vive con un hijo, los otros están acompañados.

Sara, tiene tres años de dedicarse a la agricultura y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron este oficio, ya que también son agricultores, el terreno donde cultiva está a una distancia de 25 minutos a pie, los cuales recorre cada vez que va a trabajar al cultivo, trabaja junto con su hijo en la producción de maíz.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos  como: abono, herbicidas y plaguicidas.

Los sueños a futuro de Sara son, ayudar a su hijo para que se prepare y pueda estudiar, además quiere hacerle unas reparaciones a la casa.
texts.en:
Sara is a 33-year-old single mother with a first-grade education. She lives with one of her children, a son, as the others live with partners. 

Sara has made a living growing corn for the past three years, having learned to farm from her parents. Sara works a plot that is 25 minutes from her home, and she and her son walk there when they need to work in the cornfields.  

Sara will use this loan for the purchase of supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides.  

One of Sara's goals is to help her son prepare to get an education. She'd also like to make some repairs to her home.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Gilda Guevara

texts.es:
Gilda, de 50 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 están en la escuela, su hijo mayor trabaja de seguridad.

Gilda, se dedica a oficios domésticos.

El crédito será para reparar su vivienda, porque se acerca la época lluviosa y tiene miedo mojarse.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos formarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Gilda is 50 years old. She did not go to school. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. They have six children, three of whom are in school. Her eldest son works in security. 

Gilda is a housewife.

The loan will be used to repair her home, because the rainy season is drawing near and she is worried about getting wet. Her dream is to see her children get an education.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 35 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Edna has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Edna aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 30 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

For two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. To purchase items to sell in her store, she requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF.  This will help to fill her shelves with products, such as eggs, sweets, and other groceries.

In the future, Noralyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Catherine has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, biscuits, candies and other groceries. In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Villasiare

texts.en:
Villasiare is 55 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Villasiare has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Villasiare aspires to save enough in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
Adrian es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas.
Él es inteligente, generoso, solidario, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en la Universidad Técnica ubicada en el centro de la ciudad; un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 16-26 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Adrian es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que ya no habla porque estudia inglés técnico y estudia en español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que tiene una casa propia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Trabaja como digitalizador en una empresa de seguros y se encuentra estudiando el cuarto año de la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas, al terminar sus estudios desea realizar un diplomado. “me encuentro realizando mis pasantías profesionales en una aseguradora del medio y estoy ansioso de terminar mis estudios para iniciar un diplomado...” comenta. Su sueño es finalizar su carrera profesional y continuar sus estudios, él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar las últimas cuotas de su universidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se encuentra estudiando y trabajando.
Es por esos motivos que Adrian solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar las últimas cuotas de su carrera profesional para continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adrian is a 22 year-old young man. He is single, has no children, and is studying for a degree in systems engineering. He is intelligent, generous, cooperative, optimistic, responsible, and hard-working. He takes his classes at the Technical University located in the center of the city. It is an area characterized by business in all parts, and houses universities, public offices and private businesses that coexist side by side. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature between 16 to 26 degrees Celsius that varies during the day.

Adrian has brown skin, short black hair, dark eyes, a short stature, and a thin physique. His native language is Quechua, which he no longer speaks because he has studied Spanish and technical English. He lives his life in the company of his parents that have their own house made of brick with a corrugated iron roof, drinking water, electricity, and a sewage system. 

He works as a scanner in an insurance company, and is currently studying in his fourth year of a systems engineering degree. Upon finishing his studies he wants to complete a certificate. He mentions, "I am completing my professional internship in an environmental insurance company and I am anxious to finish my studies to start on a certificate." His dream is to finish his professional work and continue with his studies. He wants to buy a portable computer and to pay the last of his university tuition. 

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that he has been studying and working. For these reasons Adrian is requesting a loan to buy a portable computer and to pay the last of his university tuition in order to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer and to pay the last of his university tuition in order to continue studying.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en: Isabelita has started her small business and become a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay(village). Recently, she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Floresa

texts.en:
Floresa is 26 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines and has been in business for five years. 

Floresa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. With her profits, Floresa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. For the past year, she has earned income from this store and a food vending business.

Josephine repaid one loan from NWTF and now requests a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to increase her inventory and buy items to sell, such as coffee, soap, and groceries.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as coffee, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is 59 years old and married with three children.  

Herminigilda is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Herminigilda has been in this business for 25 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Herminigilda would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, aged 43, reached her fifth year of elementary school. She is a married mother and has four children, all of whom attend school. Stella contributes  to paying for family expenses; therefore, she is working hard to achieve success.

For four years, Stella has been involved in her business in which she sells cooked rice and stew as it was the best way to earn an income. She also does the housework. Her mother is the only one who helps with the business. Stella goes out to different places to sell her goods. Stella is happy to offer her customers excellent service. 

The loan she needs is to buy rice and ingredients to prepare rice and stew to sell to customers. Her dream is to see her children become professionals because she did not have the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: To buy rice and ingredients to prepare rice and stew to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
In 2007, Ann started farming on her husband's 1.4 acre piece of land in Kamobo village in Kenya. Today, the farm is home to three large dairy cows and sheep. To provide extra support for her family of four children, Ann cultivates crops and runs a shop in order to earn additional income. Being able to contribute to what her husband of 15 years provides surely gives her a great sense of joy.

One way in which Ann has chosen to increase her income is through improving milk production on her farm. To achieve a state where her three dairy cows are in perfect health, Ann is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to buy a chaff cutter to cut hay into small even pieces that the cows will enjoy. With more to chew, they will need more to drink and this will lead to more milk for Ann's family to consume and sell.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María es una mujer campesina, luchadora, echada para adelante a sus 64 años de años es soltera y supo desempeñar el papel de madre y padre, vive cerca a sus hija y juntas se mantiene, su responsabilidad y su nobleza son muy reconocidos por los vecinos del sector y es esta manera de ser la que le ha dado éxito en su negocio.
María se dedica a la cría y levante de pollos y gallinas, sus impecables cocheras, su responsabilidad para alimentarlos con maíz hacen que estos animales sean muy apetecidos por los clientes.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, enchapar el baño, revocar paredes, pintar, reparar el patio, reparar el lavado, comprar electrodomésticos muchas cosas para embellecer su hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para construir una cochera para iniciar en el negocio de ganado porcino, comprar una cerda de cría y lechones y el resto de capital en gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
María is a farming woman and a fighter, pushing ahead at age 64.  She is single, and she knew how to fulfill the roles of both mother and father. She lives near her daughters and together, they get by.  Her responsibility and her integrity are well known by the neighbors in the sector, and being this way has made her successful in her business.

María raises chickens and hens.  Her impeccable pens and her responsibility in feeding her animals with corn make her animals very desirable to her customers. 

Her biggest dream is to improve her housing conditions by laying tile in the bathroom, plastering the walls, painting, repairing the patio and the washing machine, purchasing household appliances, and doing many things to beautify her home.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials to build a pen in order to start a pig-raising business, and to purchase a breeding sow and piglets.  She will spend the rest of the capital on laying hens.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a pen in order to start a pig-raising business, a breeding sow and piglets, and laying hens.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las tres Marías” conformada por 6 mujeres emprendedoras y responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Beatriz de 42 años es separada con 02 hijos uno de ellos dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas. Gracias a su trabajo Beatriz  ha podido  sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras. Su deseo es de poner una jugueria, Seguir trabajando positivamente. El grupo “las tres Marías” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Beatriz se encuentra de pie,  es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste blusa color negro.
texts.en: “Las Tres Marías” [The Three Marias] communal bank is comprised of six enterprising, responsible women seeking to improve each day.  Beatriz, 42, is separated with two children, and one of them is dependent.  She is engaged in selling meals.  Thanks to her work, Beatriz has been able to get her children ahead and improve her home.  Her latest loan will be used to purchase rice, oil, and soup. She also wishes to set up a juice bar, and continue working positively.  “Las Tres Marías” group is grateful to the people that make this loan possible.  In the photo, Beatriz is standing, first from the left, and wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, and soup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily joined PMPC  for her needed capital. As a farmer in Clarin, she wants to continue her farming activities when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to Lily as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Lily perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old now.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.ru: Махфуза проживает в городке Худжанда. Худжанд также считается северной столицей. Махфуза замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Муж работает сварщиком. Сыну 21 год он студент. Махфуза занимается шитьем платков. Он шьет платки и делает на них вышивку. Махфуза работает в этой сфере уже 5 лет. Она любит свою работу и хочет дальше работать в этой сфере деятельности. Махфуза хочет купить еще одну швейную машинку, чтобы ускорить процесс работы, потому что ее заказы увеличиваются и Махфуза хочет принимать больше заказов и удержать клиентов. На покупку швейной машинки у Махфузы не хватает денег, так как она стоит очень дорого. Она видит выход из этой ситуации в получении кредита. Пооддержите Махфузу.
texts.en: Mahfuza lives in the town of Khujand. Khujand is also considered the northern capital. Mahfuza is married and has one child. Her husband works as a welder. Her son is 21. He is a student. Mahfouz makes shawls. She sews scarves and embroiders them. Mahfuza has been doing this for five years. She loves her job and wants to continue to work in this field. Mahfuza wants to buy another sewing machine to speed up her work. She has been getting more orders which she would like to fulfill to keep her customers. Mahfuza does not have enough money to buy a sewing machine since they are very expensive. Her only way out of this situation is taking out a loan. Support her.

loans.use: A loan of $375 helps Mahfuza buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elfida Albertina

texts.es: Elfida de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elfida is 44 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion. For more than 10 years, she has been preparing and selling tortillas. Her business is located at her place of residence and she has many customers. With the income she earns from her sales, Elfida is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal [1 quintal = 100 kg] and lime powder so that she can continue preparing tortillas. As a result, she will be able to generate more income so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder in bulk for making tortillas.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén Darío es un ganadero de 43 años de edad, es soltero su única preocupación son sus niñas (vacas), estos animales que han sabido enamorarlo, los respeta y trata de que su actividad no los dañe.
Su negocio lo heredo de su familia, proviene de una larga tradición de lecheros, y aunque le ha tocado un tiempo difícil donde el precio de venta de leche ha bajado considerablemente, los insumos y vacunas cuestan demasiados sigue en pie honrando el trabajo que está en sus venas. 
Rubén solita un apoyo financiero para comprar 3 terneros, pues cree en un mito de que se cría los terneros desde recién nacidos la relación ser amucho mejor y aprende a conocerlos mejor.
texts.en:
Rubén Darío, 43, raises cows. He is single, and his girls (cows) are his only concern.  These animals have known how to win his heart; he respects them and strives so that they are not harmed by his work. 

He inherited his business from his family; he comes from a long line of dairy farmers. Although he has had a difficult time, as the sale price of milk has dropped considerably and supplies and vaccinations cost too much, he keeps going, honoring the work that runs through his veins.

Rubén is requesting financial support in order to purchase three calves, as he believes in the myth that raising newborn calves makes for a much better relationship, and one learns to know them better.

loans.use: to purchase three calves for his farm.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama LA ESPERANZA están en el primer ciclo es un grupo nuevo que tiene todas las expectativas de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Todas ellas ponen todo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer.
Entre ellas se destaca a la Sra. Gladys,  por su espíritu emprendedor, se desempeña como empleada doméstica, es muy trabajadora, y comenta que busca una mejor forma para poder crecer y salir adelante, es por ello que quiere emprender en la venta de comidas. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne y otros, y de esa forma poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee named “La Esperanza” (The Hope) is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group in which all of its members have expectations of being able to grow and improve living conditions for themselves and their families. All of them are doing everything they can so that they can grow.

One of the members who stands out is Sra. Gladys because of her enterprising spirit. She is a domestic employee and a very hard worker. Gladys says that she is looking for a better way to grow and move forward. For this reason, she wants to start selling food.

Gladys is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for preparing food such as vegetables, condiments, meat, and other items. This will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, and other supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos, venta de chalecos y chamarras, venta de frutas, servicio de albañil, venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marina es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar que estos productos eran ampliamente comercializados en el mercado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina) que adquirirá de tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su taller de costura para la elaboración de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Copacabana” communal bank will begin its second cycle with pro Mujer as part of the” Centro Focal de Santiago II”.   The group is comprised of eight members, and is managed by a board of directors where Marina is president.    The members of the association  engage in varied businesses including selling sportswear, vests and jackets, fruit, meals, and vegetables as wells as providing building services, and operating a neighborhood store.
The loan they are taking out w
ill benefit small businesses where Marina is a member.  She says that this is her first year as a member of Pro Mujer, and she joined in response to an invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling sportswear, and relates that she undertook this business several years ago by her own initiative, noting that these products were widely sold in the market.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase working capital through the purchase of a sewing machine that she will acquire from shops in La Paz, and later install in her sewing workshop to make her products.  This type of work will permit her to generate income to support her family financially as she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she enjoys the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 29 лет. Она живет в северном городе республики, в городе Худжанд. Саодат живет вместе с мужем и детьми.  Она вместе с мужем работают не покладая рук, чтобы обеспечить своих детей и дать им хорошее образование. Ее муж таксист. Саодат предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды. Чтобы не лишиться источника дохода, Саодату необходимо срочно купить швейную машинку. Ее нынешняя машинка не в состоянии дальше работать и Саодат не видит иного выхода, чем в обращение за кредитом и покупки новой машинки. Саодат надеется и верит, что найдутся люди, которые ей помогут и она сможет сохранить заработок.
texts.en: Saadat is 29. She lives in the northern city of Khujand. Saadat lives with her husband and children. She and her husband are working tirelessly to ensure that their children are raised properly and given a good education. Her husband is a taxi driver. Saadat is a dressmaker. She takes custom orders for women's clothes. In order not to lose their source of income, Saadat urgently needs to buy a sewing machine. Her current machine no longer works, and Saadat has no other option but to apply for a loan to buy a new machine. Saadat hopes and believes that there are people who will help her so she can continue earning a living.

loans.use: A loan of $ 500 helps Saadat purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $200 helps Dilrabo to increase her livestock and expand her business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 54 years old and married with five children. The family lives in Siquijor, Philippines. Carmelita has her own stall, where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of their family. Since she wants to generate more income, Carmelita joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 13,500 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the fish market at nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and married with six children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, soap, shampoo, etc. Gina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Gina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза молодая женщина из района Спитамен. Ей 32 года. Дилноза замужем, но ее муж уехал на заработки. Она на Родине работает в колхозе. Также она арендовала не большой участок земли, где каждый год сеет пшеницу. Дилноза несмотря на свою занятость и тяжелую работу она хочет начать собственный бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она решила заняться купля и продажей скотин, чтобы приносить в дом хороший источник дохода и обеспечить своих детей всем. Так как у нее не много капитала она обратилась за кредитом. На заемные деньги она купит только скотов, потому что она уже построила коровник и запаслась кормом.
texts.en: Dilnoza is a young woman from Spitamen. She is 32 years old. Dilnoza is married, but her husband left home to work. She works in her home country on a farm. Also, she has rented a small plot of land where she grows wheat every year. Despite her busy schedule and the hard work involved, Dilnoza wants to start her own business in animal husbandry. She decided to start buying and selling cattle so that she can earn a decent income and provide her children with everything they need. Since she does not have much cash, she has applied for a loan. With the money she is borrowing she will only buy livestock since she has already built a barn and stocked up on feed.

loans.use: buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Ramon Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Ramón Enrique de 35 años de edad es casado, tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de él vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, vive en casa propia y se dedica desde hace 06 años  al negocio de transporte en  taxi.
Don Ramón Enrique tiene taxi propio y casa propia es un hombre trabajador que desea seguir luchando para tener una mejor forma de vida.
Está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de repuestos para el vehículo y llantas, con el apoyo de este crédito espera poder darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y también obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan salir adelante con su familia.
 Su sueño para este año es mejorar su unidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Ramón Enrique, age 35, is married, with two children who depend upon him. He lives in a community in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras. He lives in his own house, and he has been in the taxi business for six years.

Ramón Enrique has his own taxi and his own house; he is a hardworking man who wants to keep fighting to have a better life.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of replacement parts and tires for his vehicle, and with the support of this loan, he hopes to be able to provide better service to his customers and also obtain good earnings that will allow him and his family to get ahead.

His dream for this year is to improve his vehicle and his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras—January, 2015

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts and tires for his taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, glue, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбубе 37 лет. Она живет на районе Спитамен, в северной части Таджикистана. Махбуба замужем и имеет троих детей. Она вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством. Семья арендовала 0,5 гектаров земли, где каждый год сажает морковь и лук. Махбуба хочет стать финансово устойчивым человеком. Она решила начать бизнес в сфере животноводство. На данный момент у нее имеется скот и достаточный опыт работы в этой сфере. Ранее она держала скотин для семьи, но сейчас решила использовать их для бизнеса. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить еще больше скотов и начать бизнес и принести в дом новый источник дохода.
texts.en: Mahbuba is 37. She lives in Spitamen in northern Tajikistan. Mahbuba is married and has three children. She and her family farm. The family rents 0.5 hectares of land where they grow carrots and onions every year. Mahbuba wants to become financially stable. She decided to start a livestock business. She currently keeps cattle, and she has sufficient experience. Previously, she kept the family's cattle, but now she has decided to use them for business. She applied for a loan to buy more cattle and start a business so that the household would have an additional source of income.

loans.use: A loan of $500 helps Mahbuba buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Liezel is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. Nelia is 45 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelia has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Nelia has been in this business for one year. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Nida has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maegen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maegen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns income from pig fattening. Maegen is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Maegen has sustained her business through four past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice grains, canned goods, noodles, candies and bread to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es: Marlene de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace 3 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, leche, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marlene is 47 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband and child. For 3 years she has operated a store out of her home, and has many customers because of the variety of products and good prices. She gets by with what she makes from her sales, and is applying for a loan to purchase more soups, eggs, staple foods, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, milk, etc, so she can raise her income and her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more soups, eggs, staple foods, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, milk, etc.

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve more her business if you will let her borrow 10,000 PHP. This new loan will buy groceries and other products she needs to expand her inventory. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family with this assistance.

Menchie wants to expand he business to improve her financial condition. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-----------------------

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Renefy

texts.en:
Renefy, the breadwinner in her family, is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 55 years old and married. 

She never gets tired of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her family. 

Renefy is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her good standing, without default. 

Now, Renefy has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Natanael

texts.es:
Natanael tiene 61 años, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge en el distrito de Púcará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente y los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto a un mejor precio lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Natanael is 61 years old, and lives in a house of his own built from rustic materials with his spouse in the district of Pucara, located in the province of Jaen, in the region of Cajamarca in Peru's northern mountains. Life is in this district is peaceful and its inhabitants work primarily in agriculture and raising animals.

He works in agriculture, specifically pineapple farming, and has 8 years of experience in this field and good references amongst the area's inhabitants. He'll use the loan towards agricultural purposes, applying and adding pesticide products, fertilizers, and labor for the harvest. This will help improve his crop physiologically, morphologically, and in terms of productivity. It will also allow him to have a timely harvest and thus higher production, a higher quality product, and enable him to sell his product at a higher price with no trouble, which will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To use towards agricultural purposes, for applying and adding pesticide products, fertilizer, and labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a crochet business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in business for eight years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Angel Alfer

texts.en:
Angel Alfer is 32 years and mother of two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angel Alfer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like  beverages, eggs, canned goods, bread, etc. She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Angel Alfer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like  beverages, eggs, canned goods, bread, etc.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 36 years old and has two children who attend school.

Margie has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase vegetables to sell to customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to build her business. Margie has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.en:
Manuelita is 27 years old and married with two children. One child attends school, Manuelita works very hard to provide for them.

Manuelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft-drinks, coffee, milk, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Manuelita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

Manuelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soft-drinks, coffee, milk, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, age 34, is a married woman with five children; three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Brenda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell. Brenda has been in business for 15 years. 

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Edeliza  works very hard to provide for them.

Edeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc. She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Edeliza would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geraldine is 35 years old and has one child in school.

Geraldine has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Geraldine has been in this business for three years. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Gouagnouma est la dame qui tient la corde du mouton en main.  Elle est Malienne  âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un cultivateur et mère de 4 enfants.  Ils sont âgés de 14 à 17 ans dont 3 vont à l’école.  Elle  emprunte de l’argent  auprès de RMCR  pour  acheter plus de moutons au moment propice pour l’élevage. Elle s’approvisionne sur les marchés locaux et revend ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés après  l’élevage. 
Les bénéfices dont elle réalise la permettent  d’aider son mari de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en (nourriture, habillement, santé,  et  frais de scolarités). Le rêve de Gouagnouma est  de devenir une grande exportatrice de mouton afin d’aider sa communauté dans l’avenir. Elle se sent à laisse d’exercer cette activité car elle  parvient à satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants et elle même.
texts.en:
Gouagnouma is a woman holding the sheep’s rope in her hand. She is Malian, 35 years old, married to a farmer, and the mother of four children. They are aged 14 to 17, and three of them go to school. 

Gouagnouma is borrowing money from RMCR to purchase at the right time additional sheep for her livestock farming. She supplies herself at the local markets and resells her animals at the same markets after raising them. The profits she makes enable her to help out her husband in meeting the needs of the family with regards to food, clothing, healthcare, and school fees.

Gouagnouma’s dream is to become a major exporter of sheep, so as to help her community in the future. She feels at ease operating this business, since she manages to meet the needs of her children, as well as her own.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and resell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 30 years old and has four children who attend school.

Mary Ann has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ready to wear to sell to customers. She has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ready to wear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Adjo est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Adjo vit à Gbomamé pour exercer efficacement son activité. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Adjo vend des sous-vêtements et des friperies dans son quartier. Cette activité lui procure un gain afin de répondre à ses besoins. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché de Hédzranawoé. Adjo nécessite ce crédit pour commander des friperies et des sous-vêtements afin de satisfaire favorablement les besoins de ses consommateurs.
texts.en: A married mother of two children, Adjo is 44 years old and lives in Gbomamé to operate her business effectively. So that her family may thrive, she sells undergarments and secondhand clothing in her neighborhood. This business brings in a profit to meet her needs. She gets her supplies once a month at the Hédzranawoé market. Adjo needs this loan to order some secondhand clothing and undergarments in order to satisfy the needs of her consumers.

loans.use: to purchase 13 dozen of undergarments

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es  un joven de 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad muy lejana y poco poblado de Sololá.
Diego es un muchacho amable y muy solidario, es por eso que desde hace 5 años él se dedica  a la agricultura, a Diego le gusta convivir con la naturaleza y con el sudor en la frente genera sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia, Diego realiza esta actividad porque el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y ser un gran profesional  pues lamentablemente sus padres no tenían la posibilidad de poder ayudarlo, pero para el esto no es ninguna limitación para no luchar por la vida, ser agricultor para él es un orgullo porque él aprendió con su padre y ahora a pesar de ser demasiado joven ha logrado ya ser independiente, en el lugar donde él vive es una zona muy fértil que produce buenas verduras, es por eso que el en esta época quiere sembrar  sus hortalizas pero una de las limitaciones de  Diego es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder sembrar, entonces él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
El sueño de Diego es poder conseguir este préstamo y poder incrementar sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a 19-year-old, young and single man. He lives with his parents in the very remote and sparsely populated community of 'Sololá'.

Diego is kind and caring. That is why he has made a living in agriculture for 5 years, he likes to live in contact with nature. With the sweat of his brow, he manages to get an income to help his family

 Diego works in agriculture because he didn't have the opportunity to study or be a great professional. Unfortunately, his parents did not have the means to help him. However, this imposed no limitations for him to fight for a good life.

Being a farmer is an honor to him because he learned the craft with his father and now, in spite of being too young, he has managed to work independently.

The place where he lives is a very fertile area that produces good vegetables. That is the reason why he wants to plant his vegetables now. But, one of Diego's limitations is that he does not have enough money to sow. Therefore, hedecided to request a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

Diego wishes his loan would get funded so that he can increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Hapolita

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cocinas artesanales y productos de jardinería desde hace 14 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal que está cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and has worked in sales of artisanal stoves and gardening products for 14 years. Her business is located in the municipal market nearby her house, and she has many customers because of the quality of her products and the good prices. She gets by with what makes from the sales and lives in a house of her own with her husband. She's applying for a loan to purchase more products wholesale so she can keep her sales going and that way earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase artisanal stoves and gardening products.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
This is Leila, 55, resident of Batasan Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a driver and mechanic. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leila operates a food stall in the Philippines. The entire working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas to feed food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and residents from the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Leila is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to buy more products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and other supplies for her business. She also buys and sells ready-to-wear items to her customers at lower price.

Leila hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-------------------------------------

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business and purchase items of clothing.

loans.name: Werner Wilfredo

texts.es: Werner tiene 39 años de edad y vive con su esposa en casa propia, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, donde elabora puertas, balcones, entre otros, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el  solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así continuar con su trabajo para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Werner is 39 years old and lives with his wife in a home of their own. He owns a metalworking shop where he creates doors, balconies, and more. For 20 years he's been in this line of work and he has lots of experience, which helps him improve his craft every day. He has lots of customers who come to him because of the quality of his work, and with the profit he obtains he manages to pay some of his household's expenses. He's requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so he can buy iron, metal, tools, etc and that way continue doing his job and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en:
Nerisa is 45 years old and married with five children.

Nerisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like breads, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

Nerisa has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She has run her general store for 10 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Nerisa aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like breads, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and has five children. Gina is married and has three children who attend school.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been in this business for 15 years and has borrowed one time in the past, from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 54 years old and married with three children who attend school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and widiowed with four children. Two children attend school, Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, etc.

Josefina has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 62 years old and married with children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Julia is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 42 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Julia successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests a loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nanelyn

texts.en:
Nanelyn is 39 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Nanelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries items to sell in her general store.

Nanelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 10 years and also earns income from vegetable vending.

Nanelyn aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 59 years old and has two children. Librada is married woman.

Librada is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Librada has been in this business for four years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Librada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Mawussi est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Mawussi vit à Adidogomé pour exercer efficacement son activité. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Mawussi vend des détergents dans la boutique de son domicile. Cette activité lui procure un gain qui ne couvre pas suffisamment ses besoins. Mawussi s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au grand marché de Lomé. Mawussi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des cartons de savons et des détergents afin de satisfaire favorablement les besoins de ses consommateurs.
texts.en: A married mother of two children, Mawussi is 40 years old and lives in Adidogomé to operate her business effectively. So that her family may thrive, Mawussi sells detergents at a shop in her home. This business brings in a profit which does not cover her needs enough. She gets her supplies once a week at the big market of Lomé. Mawussi requires this loan to order boxes of soaps and detergents, so as to satisfy her consumers.

loans.use: to purchase a box of detergent

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Aquilina requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell to customers.

Aquilina has been in this business for 32 years now.

In the future, Aquilina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi est agée 35 ans et vit à Atigangomé. Elle  est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge. Elle vend des céréales dans les marchés et dans son quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour subvenir à ses charges et s’épanouir. Amavi s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché de Notsè. Amavi veut passer une commande de sacs de maïs et du haricot et demande ce crédit pour le réaliser. Amavi souhaite disposer d’un local  et élargir son activité.
texts.en: Amavi is 35 years old and lives in Atigangomé. She is unmarried and has one person to support. She sells grains at the markets in her district to have the profit necessary to support herself and to thrive. Amavi gets her supplies once a week at the Notsè market. She wants to  put in an order for sacks of corn and beans and is asking for this loan to do so. She would like to have a location for her business and to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beans

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Patricia has been in the pig fattening business for eight years and also earns income by operating a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Norma, de 37 años de edad, solo estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos y ambos están estudiando.

Norma, desde hace dos años se dedica a vender tortillas, este trabajo lo aprendió por necesidad de los recursos economicos  y el deseo de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.- Antes trabajaba con su esposo en la siembra de maíz y maicillo, hoy en día le ayuda, pero es menos.- Además del negocio de tortillas, también le gusta la crianza de ganado.- Actualmente, cuenta con con dos novillas que ya están para parir, ella se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para coser el maíz, ya que a las 8:00 a.m. se va para el molino, su negocio está a dos cuadras de su casa.

 El préstamo lo va a utilizar para comprar 2 novillas y cuatro sacos de maíz, para su negocio de tortillas. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria y tengan un mejor futuro, además desea llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Norma, 37 years old, only studied until the eighth grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have two children and both are studying.

Norma has sold tortillas for two years. She learned this work due to economic necessity and the desire to help her husband with the household expenses. Before this, she used to work with her husband planting corn and sorghum. Today she helps him, but less. In addition to the tortilla business, she also likes to raise cattle. She currently has two heifers that are about to give birth. Norma wakes up at 4:00am to cook corn, since at 8:00am it goes to the grinder. Her business is two blocks from her house.

She will use the loan to buy two heifers and four sacks of corn for her tortilla business.

Her dream is that her children go to university and have a better future. She also hopes to succeed in having a store.

loans.use: to buy two heifers and four sacks of corn.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marife is 42 years old, and one child is in school.

Marife has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Marife  requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marife has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Divorcée, Adjo est une femme de 55 ans qui vit à Kohé avec son enfant. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de la famille, elle vend des  friperies  en se promenant de lieu en lieu. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché de Hédzranawoé et les revend dans son quartier et réalise un bon bénéfice grâce à son activité génératrice de revenu. Adjo désire ce microcrédit pour acheter des draps et des serviettes afin de favoriser l’éducation de son enfant et  générer assez de revenus.
