texts.en: Adjo is a divorced woman, 55 years old, who lives in Kohé with her child. To support herself and to help out her family, she sells secondhand clothing by walking from place to place. She gets her supplies twice a month at the Hédzranawoé market and resells the goods in her district, thus making a profit, thanks to her revenue-generating business. Adjo would like this micro-loan to purchase bed sheets and towels for the sake of her child’s education and generating enough income.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bed sheets and 2 dozen towels

loans.name: Las Korichuymas De Percuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KORICHUYMAS DE PERCUTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de queso, venta de comida, taller mecánico, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adelia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña trabaja con este negocio, recuerda que inicio con la venta de sus ovejas para la adquisición de ganado vacuno, con el cual desarrolla su producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza lo utilizará  como medio de producción. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los beneficios que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community organization Las Korichuymas De Percuta will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors in which Adela is the president. The businesses run by the organization's members are varied, and include: selling milk, selling cheese, selling food, a repair shop, and construction services.

The loan obtained will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs, Adela being one of them, and she states this is the first time that she has been a part of Pro Mujer. She joined through the invitation of a massive campaign that the institution launched in the area. Currently she has a milk selling business, and says she learned this trade from her parents since she done this type of work since she was a little girl. She recalls starting the business by selling her sheep to acquire dairy cows which she uses for production.

The loan she's obtaining now will be used to increase her working capital (purchasing dairy cows) which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the community, and after raising the animals she will use it as a means of production. This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family financially, since she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the benefits that the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in home improvements that would ensure peace and safety for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old, married and had three children. Two are in high school and her youngest child is in an elementary grade. She wanted to sustain her children's need for education. 

To gain income, she is managing a store selling grocery items. She is now asking for additional capital of 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. This will help improve capacity of sales in her business. She hopes to acquire good income and continue extending affordable and good services.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean is 18 years old from Doña Lucia, Quezon, Nueva Ecija. He has two siblings and they are supported by their parents thru farming and a small eatery. 

He is currently studying for a BS in Civil Engineering. Sean hopes to finish college so he can help his family out of poverty and give them a better future. 

To do that, he wants to avail a loan of PHP150,000 from the KIVA lenders to continue pursuing his college education and be successful in his chosen field.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Cjfdt 32 Group

texts.fr: CJFDT 32 est affilié à la convergence des jeunes et femmes pour le développement de Tassette. C'est un sous groupe qui est composé de 05 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Ils habitent tous dans le même village et font pratiquement les même activités.  Ils se réunissent tous les fins de mois et organisent des cotisation mensuelles. La présidente s'appelle BOUSSA, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation du bétail. Elle est à son 2ème prêt et sollicite ce dernier pour acheter des moutons, les élever et ensuite les vendre. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle souhaite à l'avenir avoir une ferme agricole et diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
CJFDT 32 is affiliated with the convergence of youngsters and women for the development of Tassette. This is a sub-group composed of five persons, who are all women. They live together in the same village and practically do the same type of work. They all meet once a month and organize their monthly dues. 

The president’s name is BOUSSA. She is the one in the photo with a hand raised. She is a married mother working at selling farm animals. She is on her 2nd loan and is asking for it to purchase sheep to raise and then sell. She has over ten years of experience. Her day begins at 8 AM and ends at 5 PM. 

For the future, she would like to have a farm and to diversify her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to raise and then resell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 61 years old and married with three children. Angela works very hard to provide for them.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like coffee, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell.

Angela has been in this business for 40 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc. 

Angela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like coffee, juice, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc., to sell

loans.name: Meritchele

texts.en:
Meritchele is 27 years old and married with one child. Meritchele works very hard to provide for them.

Meritchele runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc..

Meritchele has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Meritchele would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merle Ann

texts.en:
Merle Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merle Ann is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Merle Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merle Ann has been in this business for two years. In the future, Merle Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old and a married woman with three children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has had a furniture-making business in the Philippines for 11 years. 

Carmen has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima works hard to support her family. Prima is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Prima requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc., for her business.

Prima has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Prima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ruselle

texts.en:
Ruselle is 52 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ruselle is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ruselle has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 40 years old and a married woman with five children. One of them attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has had a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines for the last year. 

Mila requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Cfjdt 16 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 16 est affilié à la Convergence pour le Développement de Tassette. Il est composé de 8 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent dans le même village et pratique les mêmes activités. Elles se réunissent tous les fins de mois et organisent des tontines. La présidente s'appelle Marie, c'est elle qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans l'agriculture des céréales comme le mil, maïs, les haricots. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences et des intrants pour pratiquer l'agriculture. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle souhaite à l'avenir avoir une ferme agricole et diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses revenus ainsi elle pourra épargner de l'argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa belle famille.
texts.en:
CJFDT 16 is affiliated with the Convergence for the Development of Tassette. It is composed of eight persons, who are all women. They live in the same village and have the same work. They all meet at the end of each month and organize their tontines. 

The president’s name is Marie. She is the one in the photo with a hand raised. She is a married mother working at the farming of grains, such as millet, corn, and beans. She has over ten years of experience. Her day begins at 8 AM and ends at 5 PM.

She is requesting this sum of money to purchase seeds and inputs for farming. She helps out her husband in managing day-to-day family expenses and the children’s schooling costs. 

For the future, she would like to have a farm and to diversify her business, as well as to increase her revenues. Thus, she will be able to save some money and improve living conditions for her in-laws.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and inputs for farming

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is aged 32, married, and is blessed with a daughter. He has managed a motorcycle repair service in town for almost four years, earning a net income of PHP 3,000 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital, he needs a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase spare parts. He's hoping that his business will continue to improve, expand and become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy parts for repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 45 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Chita works very hard to provide for them. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 11 years, selling a variety of items such as shampoo, seasonings, cereals, coffee, canned goods, and soft drinks. 

Chita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 33 years old and married. She has five children.

Anafe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, sugar, and cereals to sell.

Anafe has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns income from food vending.

Anafe aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, sugar, and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 56 ans, Akossiwa  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’Amoutiévé avec ses trois enfants à sa charge. Akossiwa est très dynamique et vend de la pâte emballée préparée à l’aide du maïs pour ses clients. Son activité ne lui procure pas assez de bénéfices pour venir en aide aux besoins de la famille. Akossiwa s’approvisionne une  fois par mois au marché de Hanoukopé. Adjo demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs  de maïs afin de préparer une bonne quantité de ses nourritures aux clients et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 56-years old woman living in the Amoutieve neighborhood with her three dependent children. She is a very energetic person and cooks wrapped corn meal mush for sale. Her business does not yield sufficient revenues to help cover family expenses. She stocks up once a month at the Hanoukope market. Adjo is applying for this loan in order to order bags of corn and prepare a large quantity of food for sale in order to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy 330 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан 50 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Майрамкан среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1994 году, благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 10 овец, на земельной доле мерою 1,76 Га она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на ремонт ее дома.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 50 years old, married and the mother of four. Mairamkan has received secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows farm crops, having launched this business in 1994. Thanks to Mairamkan's hard work, at present she has three cows and 10 sheep; she also has  a land plot of 1.76  ha [4.3 acres], where she grows clover for use on her farm as well as for resale. In order to develop her business further, Mairamkan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy sheep. Mairamkan plans to use the resulting revenue for an additional increase of livestock and also to keep saving for home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a very jovial farmer based in the Nandi Hills region of Kenya. This year is her fifteenth year in a happy marriage that gave her four children between ages 7 and 15 years.

Mildred only started farming in 2005, but her passion for dairy and poultry farming only gets stronger by the day. She owns 5 dairy cows and over 50 heads of poultry. The only major challenge Mildred faces is the lack of a housing structure for her 5 lovely cows. As a consequence, the animals are subjected to harsh weather changes day in and day out. Mildred is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to construct a cowshed for her cows to improve their welfare and productivity. 

With your loan, she is expecting that the cows will have clean, hygienic housing, which will provide a comfortable and conducive environment for them.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, vit  Abla avec son unique enfant. Elle est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans. Abla est revendeuse de charbon de bois et gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Abla stock les charbons dans sa maison et cède ensuite aux clients qui viennent en chercher. Abla s’approvisionne au marché de Kohé une fois par semaine. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons, Abla demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Abla lives in the Adidogomé district with her only child. She is a married woman, 51 years old, and a retailer of charcoal. She earns her income each day, thanks to this business of hers. Abla stocks up charcoal in her house and then provides it to customers wanting it. She gets her supplies at the Kohé market once a week. To purchase new sacks of charcoal, Abla is asking for this loan to make her purchase and to derive an income for her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. Orlando is able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he received a loan to restock his store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been in this business for 9 years and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain the business.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Cresencia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from candle making. Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 46 years old and married. She has four children with one child currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Eva has a food vending business in the Philippines. Eva requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices for her food production business.

Eva has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Zhumabu

texts.ru: Жумабу, 52 года, вдова, 3 детей. У Жумабу среднее образование, она занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 2 коровы, 12 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Жумабу, поэтому она решила и дальше развивать свою деятельность. Жумабу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с целью разведения и увеличения поголовья, а также наращения прибыли . Доходы от кредита Жумабу будет использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на постройку нового дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Zhumabu is 52 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and works in agriculture.  She currently has two cows and 12 sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS), which is not enough to afford a decent life.  For this reason, she has decided to further develop her activity.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding, which will allow her to increase her livestock headcount and her profits.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to grow her business.  She would also like to save enough money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Akoélé vit à Attiégou aves ses cinq enfants à sa charge. Elle est une femme mariée et âgée de 48 ans. Pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille, Akoélé vend des charbons de bois afin d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Akoélé s’approvisionne  quatre fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs du marché de Tchétché. Akoélé demande ce crédit pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour relever les défis qu’elle affronte quotidiennement
texts.en: Akoélé lives in Attiégou with her five children she supports. She is a 48-year-old married woman. To help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses, Akoélé sells charcoal to obtain the income enabling them to feed themselves. She gets her supplies four times a month from the suppliers at the Tchétché market. Akoélé is asking for this loan to purchase new sacks of charcoal, from which she can earn a profit for coping with the challenges she faces each day.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine vit à Adidogomé aves ses quatre enfants à sa charge. Elle est une femme mariée et âgée de  50 ans. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Martine vend des charbons de bois afin d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Martine s’approvisionne  trois fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs du nord de Lomé. Martine demande ce crédit pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour relever les défis qu’elle affronte quotidiennement.
texts.en: Martine lives in Adidogomé with her four children she supports. She is a 50-year-old married woman. To do better at meeting the demonstrated needs of each day, Martine sells charcoal to obtain the income enabling them to feed themselves. She gets her supplies three times a month from the suppliers of northern Lomé. Martine is asking for this loan to purchase new sacks of charcoal, from which she can earn a profit for coping with the challenges she faces each day.

loans.use: to purchase 13 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон, 40 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Чолпон средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 1999 году. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Чолпон есть 6 коров, 8 овец, также на земельном наделе мерою 0,5 ГА она выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Cholpon is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children.  She has a specialized secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years, having started in this activity in 1999.  She currently has six cows and eight sheep on her farm, and she also grows alfalfa on 0.5 hectare of land.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy six sheep.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit à Amoutiévé aves ses trois enfants à sa charge. Elle est une femme mariée et âgée de 48 ans. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Adjo vend des fourchettes et les cuillères dans le marché d’Amoutiévé afin d’avoir un revenu qui lui permet de couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Adjo s’approvisionne  quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Adjo demande ce crédit pour acheter des fourchettes et cuillères et  tirer du bénéfice pour relever les défis qu’elle affronte quotidiennement.
texts.en: Adjo lives in Amoutiévé with her three children she supports. She is a 48-year-old married woman. To do better at meeting her demonstrated needs each day, she sells forks and spoons at the Amoutiévé market to have the income that enables her to cover day-to-day expenses. Adjo gets her supplies four times a month at the big market of Lomé. She is asking for this loan to purchase some forks and spoons and to derive a profit for coping with the challenges she faces each day.

loans.use: to purchase 19 dozen spoons and 19 dozen forks

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en: Dolor has been running her variety store for almost 14 years. She is happily married and blessed with three children. Dolor plans to increase her grocery stocks, but her capital is not sufficient. For this reason, she is seeking financial assistance of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used to purchase grocery items such as sugar, milk, seasonings, canned goods, and assorted biscuits to sell. Dolor hopes that through this loan, she will obtain a greater income and provide a quality service to all her customers.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as sugar, milk, seasonings, canned goods, and assorted biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: ADAMA est né en JUILLET 1974 à MORON, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali .Mr ADAMA est âgé de 41ans avec 6 enfants. Mr ADAMA réside à MORON dans une famille nucléaire. Mr ADAMA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de bœufs. Sa vente se fait à NIENA et à TENGRELA. Fort de ses 7 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son cinquième prêt. Mr ADAMA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 bœufs. Il s’approvisionne à MORON et environnants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Mr ADAMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
ADAMA was born in JULY 1974 in MORON, Commune de KADIANA, a sub-prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He resides in MORON in a nuclear family. He quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of cattle. His sales are made in NIENA and in TENGRELA. 

With a good seven years of experience in this domain, ADAMA is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to increase his business capital, so as to satisfy his  ever-growing customer base. He is now on his 5th loan. 

With this loan, he intends to buy 4 head of cattle. He gets his supplies in and around MORON. He makes his sales to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase peanuts to process into peanut butter and then sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Renee

texts.en: Renee is age 44 and married. They are blessed with three children. She has sold fruits and vegetables in their village for almost 2 years and earns a net income of 10,000 PHP a month. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily needs and on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient capital, she would like a loan of 18,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of her delivery van for fruits and vegetables. She is hoping that her business will continue to grow productively and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her delivery van for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Her name is Jocelyn; she is aged 42 years, and is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She has one child who is still in the Elementary Level at school. She works hard to support herself and her child's school needs.

Jocelyn has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands such as Avon and Natasha. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalog of the customers and sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan that she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries and undergarments for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help in their daily sustenance and for her child's education.   

Jocelyn aims to grow her business so she can give her child a better life. She prays for a happy and healthy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for clothing, footwear, skin and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past 25 years.  She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.  Lolita earns additional income from her general store.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Cruzita

texts.en:
Cruzita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall for her meat vending business. Cruzita has been in this business for 32 years. She earns more income from general store.

Cruzita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall.

loans.name: Zaide

texts.en: Zaide is 35 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. Zaide has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Zaide would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 34 years old and has five children. She is married and four children are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming corn for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 36-year old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has run an abaca weaving business in the Philippines for the last four years.

Geraldine requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 56 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this for two years, and also earns extra income from a general store.

Fredeswinda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 32 года, замужем, есть 5 детей. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад Нургул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает рис для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нургул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения поголовья коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение и расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurgul is 32 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, she started raising livestock and growing crops five years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows on her farm.  She also grows rice (for resale) on one hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
Jerlie is 41 years old and married. She has two children. With both children in school, Jerlie works very hard to provide for them.

Jerlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

Jerlie has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Jerlie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Atyrgul

texts.ru: Атыргул, 29 лет, замужем, 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Образование у Атыргул среднее. Успешно занимаясь животноводством, она добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 2 лошади, 5 овец, на участке мерою 0,52 Га она выращивает ячмень. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыргул обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. На прибыль от кредита она планирует увеличить своё хозяйство, и мечтает накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Atyrgul is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children of preschool age.  She has a secondary education.  She is a successful farmer and she has managed to develop her farming business very well.  She currently has two horses and five sheep, and she also grows barley on 0.52 hectare of land.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase her business.  She's also dreaming of saving enough money to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Muslim

texts.en:
Muslim lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and two children. He owns a small stall where he provides mobile payment services to his community. 

Muslim joined Ruma in 2013 and is now applying for a second loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. The previous loan helped him to process more mobile transactions and he thanks all of his lenders for that.  

With assistance and support from Ruma, Muslim has seen improvement in his business. His community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile payment service provider. As the business grows, he hopes to borrow more working capital from Kiva. Thus loan will help Muslim improve his business and his community, which needs access to such services.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Barpygul

texts.ru: Барпыгул, 52 года, замужем. У Барпыгул среднее образование, 34 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 3 лошади. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный доход Барпыгул от ведения бизнеса около 16,500 сом (KGS). Барпыгул добивается всего своими силами, знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Barpygul is 52 years old and married.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in farming for 34 years.  She owns four cows and three horses.  She has everything that she needs to take care of livestock.  Thanks to her business, she makes a monthly income of about 16,000 som (KGS).  She achieves everything thanks to her own efforts and she knows how to use and invest money.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Kumushkan

texts.ru: Кумушкан, 38 лет, не замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-среднее, на протяжении 14 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кумушкан, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: корова, 5 овец. На участке мерою 1,12 Га она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Кумушкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также она хочет достроить свой дом.
texts.en: Kumushkan is 38 years old, single, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and she has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 14 years.  She currently makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she has developed a successful farming business which consists of one cow, five sheep, and 1.12 hectare of land on which Kumushkan grows potatoes and corn.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase the size of her herd and to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 38 years old and has two children.

Leonita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bread, groceries, and other items to sell.

Leonita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns income from food vending.

Leonita aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bread, groceries, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Noong Luong 23 Group

texts.en:
Hoa, the rightmost person in the picture, is a 41-year old Thai lady. She is married with two daughters. One of them studies at a teacher's college; the other is a grade 7 student. She lives with her husband, daughters, and mother-in-law in a Thai traditional house. 

The family relies on agricultural work for a living, including activities such as cultivating rice, corn, and vegetables, and breeding buffalo, pigs, chickens, musk ducks, and fish. The diversity of cultivation and animal husbandry provide a stable income for the family, which motivates Hoa to enhance and expand production. 

This is the fifth time Hoa has taken a loan. She will use it to buy young fish and feed for them. She hopes the investment in fish farming will go smoothly and significantly improve her income. She dreams that her children will be successful and escape from poverty.

loans.use: to buy young fish and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 20 year old student from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. Her family earns an income from farming. With unstable income, however, her parents find it hard to sustain her schooling.  For this reason, Mary Joy wants to secure an education loan of PHP 15,000 to aid in her studies. 

Mary Joy doesn’t want to just stay where she is currently, so she is persevering to achieve a diploma and a better future for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Sorphon

texts.en:
Sorphon is a 31-year-old married factory worker with two children.  She lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sorphon has been working in the factory in a nearby province for over a year. Her husband is 31 years old and is a construction worker. One of their children attends school. 

Sorphon would like a motorcycle to commute to work and for family use, but she doesn’t have enough money so she is requesting a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to buy a motorcycle and thereby improve her traveling conditions. Sorphon plans to buy farmland to cultivate rice, build a bathroom with a toilet, and support her children to go to high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work and for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase small ruminants

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 24 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mamie has a broom making business in the Philippines. Mamie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like bamboo, wire, rope, etc. for her business.

Mamie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Mamie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like bamboo, wire, rope, etc. for her business

loans.name: Guilinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Guilinda works hard to support her family.  She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Guilinda is borrowing a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old, married, and works very hard to provide for her family.  For 2 years she has operated a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy cigarettes, canned goods, eggs, and groceries.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, canned goods, eggs, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nurpais

texts.ru: Нурпаис 34 года, женат, есть дочь. У него среднее образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи Нурпаис с 2005  года начал заниматься торговлей строительными материалами на центральном рынке. Бизнес на сегодня приносит до 35,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурпаис обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов, так как весной ожидается увеличение продаж, будет большой спрос. Доходы от кредита Нурпаис планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на обучение его дочери.
texts.en: Nurpais is 34 years old, married, and he has a daughter.  He has a secondary education.  In order to provide a source of income for his family, he has been selling construction supplies at the central market since 2005.  Thanks to his business, he makes 35,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further grow his business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy building supplies.  Sales usually increase in the spring, so his goods will be in great demand.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further develop his business, which will allow him to save enough money to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for resale on a retail basis.

loans.name: Olga De La Candelaria

texts.es:
Olga es una vividora y sobreviviente mujer, ella es de un barrio muy afectado por la pobreza, la desigualdad y el conflicto social, pero con trabajo y esfuerzo, sin quejarse quiere sacar a delante su familia, su hija de 9 años, a pesar de no tener un estudio superior un trabajo Olga se sabe rebuscar su sustento, desde su hogar es dueña y administra un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras el cual empleo para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, y en un futuro mudarse de barrio.
Su mayor preocupación es ser lo suficiente para darle estudio, vivienda, vestimenta y alimentación a su hija y trabaja muy duro para lograrlo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos lavadoras ampliando su cobertura en la zona, y posteriormente mejorar sus ingresos considerablemente.
texts.en:
Olga is a lively and resilient woman. She is from a neighborhood that's very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict, but with work and effort and without complaint, she wants to bring her family ahead. Her daughter is 9 years old. 

In spite of not having higher education, Olga knows how to earn her livelihood from home. She owns and operates a washing machine rental business, which she does to improve her family's conditions of life and move out of the neighborhood in the future.

Her biggest worry is having enough to give her daughter education, living, clothing and food, and she works very hard to achieve this. She's seeking a loan to buy two washing machines, improving her coverage in the area and later improving her income considerably.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines, improving her coverage in the area.

loans.name: Meira

texts.fr: Meira est une dame âgée de 26 ans, fiancée et mère d'un  enfant de 7 ans qui va encore à l'école. Comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville depuis 01 ans environ. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson et acheter sa licence afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice et lui permettra aussi d'être en règle dans son commerce. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Meira is a 26-year-old woman, engaged to be married, and the mother of a 7-year-old child, who is still attending school. For work, Meira has had a take-out business in her district in town for about a year. She benefits from good experience in this domain. 

With this loan, she would like to add to her cases of beverages and to purchase her license, so as to meet the demands of her customers. This will also increase her sales, as well as her profits enabling her business to be in order. The revenues generated will enable her to do better at meeting family needs. Her business ambitions include selling beverages wholesale.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and yeast for making bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of shop goods

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es: Jorge de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el tiene una librería ubicada en su casa desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y por los buenos precios, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería como: cuadernos, lapiceros, papel de regalo, resmas de papel bond, borradores, cajas de colores entre otras cosas para poder surtir aun ms su negocio y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and daughter. He has a bookstore that he has been managing from his home for three years. Jorge has many customers because of the variety of products and the good prices. Thanks to his work, he has been able to move his family forward.

Jorge is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, giftwrapping paper, reams of bond paper, erasers, crayon boxes, and other items so that he can have more inventory for his business. As a result, he will have more income.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, giftwrapping paper, reams of bond paper, erasers, crayon boxes, and other products.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.en:
Bahriniso is an amazing and gregarious woman. She is 43 years old and lives with her three children. Her husband is migrant worker in Russia. 

Bahriniso is in the dressmaking business. She has nine years experience in it. Bahriniso would like to purchase a new modern sewing machine so that she can develop her business. Her main problem is lack of finances. Bahriniso needs your support.

loans.use: To purchase a new modern sewing machine

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 20 years old and from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. She and her three siblings are supported by their parents through farming.  

Sometimes what her parents earn is insufficient, especially for her studies. Because of their financial instability, Jenny wants to secure an education loan of PHP 15,000 to sustain her schooling. 

Jenny wants to finish her studies so she can help her parents in alleviating their life.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 56 years old and married with five children. She is engaged in the business of hog raising and meat processing. 

Wilma would like to take out a loan of PHP 5,000. She will utilize this loan to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs, and some frozen foods for her food production sales business. 

Wilma believes that her business will grow continuously through this loan. Wilma is hoping for approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and feed for her hogs, and some frozen foods for her food production sales business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 36 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, condiments, groceries, etc.  Leonora has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for six years now.

Imelda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Heraclia

texts.en:
Heraclia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has operated a broom making business in the Philippines for 18 years.  She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Heraclia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Nerona

texts.en:
Nerona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nerona requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years now.

Nerona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 43 years old and married with two children.

Presentacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Presentacion has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Presentacion aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. Remedios has been in this business for 26 years. Remedios earns more income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nieva Corita

texts.en:
Nieva Corita is 58 years old and married with three children. Nieva Corita works very hard to provide for them.

Nieva Corita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, eggs, toothpaste, etc. Nieva Corita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

Nieva Corita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, eggs, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Uldarica

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Uldarica works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from firewood and charcoal vending.  Uldarica is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Uldarica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja estudió hasta segundo grado, han procreado dos hijos, los cuales aún viven con él, su pareja se dedica al oficio domestico.

José, se ha dedicado a la agricultura por más de treinta años, por lo cual conoce bien en que consiste su trabajo.

Con el crédito que solicita pretende destinarlo para comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y pagar un maestro de obra para que realice el trabajo de ampliación de su casa.

Su sueño es tener una casa amplia, para poder compartir con su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and studied through the sixth grade. He is in a relationship and his partner studied through the second grade. They have two children who still live with them. His partner takes care of the household duties.

José has been working in agriculture for more than 30 years and is well-known in his trade. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron, as well as to pay a builder to handle the work of expanding his house.

His dream is to have a larger house that he can share with his family so that he can provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and to pay a builder to expand his house.

loans.name: Nanang

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Nanang. Nanang lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about one hour from Jakarta. Nanang lives there with his wife. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks and drinks, and provides mobile payment services to his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and cheerful mobile payment service provider. 

Nanang joined Ruma in 2014. He knew of Ruma through one of his friends who was already an agent. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nanang sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Nanang improve his business and his community which needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Nanang is smiling and standing in front of his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and married with six children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from candle making.

Victoria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Limbana

texts.es: A sus 75 años de edad Limbana esta casada, tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad y casados. Limbana vive en el campo y sus ingresos los obtiene de la crianza de animales y de la agricultura. desde que era muy joven Limbana se dedica a la crianza de  chanchos y es su esposo quien le ayuda en este negocio. Limbana va a invertir el credito en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio. Limbana vive con su esposo y 2 nietos, y de su negocio aspira tener mas ingresos  suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y apoyar en la educacion a su nieta de 9 años que asiste a la escuela.
texts.en: Limbana is 75 years old married and has 7 married adult children. Limbana lives in the country and obtains her income through raising animals and agriculture. Since she was very young Limbana has made a living by raising pigs and her husband helps with the business. Limbana will invest the loan into the purchase of pigs to improve her business. Limbana lives with her husband and two grandchildren. Through her business she hopes to have earnings sufficient enough to cover costs around the home and to support the education of her nine-year-old granddaughter whose schooling she assists with.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Wurry

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Wurry. Wurry lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her children. She owns a small stall where she sells stationery and provides mobile payment services for her community. 

Wurry joined Ruma in 2013. She knew Ruma from a Ruma sales executive that came to her stall.  She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to try another business opportunity. As the business grows, Wurry is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. 

Your loan will be very useful to help Wurry improve her business and her community who needs access to such services. As you see in the photo, Wurry is sitting in her own small stall with her two children. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services for her community

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio el cual está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros, para incrementar su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Reynaldo espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. He lives with his family in the District of Oyotún, a rural area in Chiclayo Province. This community is located in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Reynaldo raises and sells animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chicks, pigs, and other livestock. He has more than 10 years of experience in this business, which he operates from his home. Reynaldo is requesting a loan in order to buy more animals such as pigs, chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, and other livestock so that he can increase his business. This investment will help him to achieve greater variety and productivity with his animals, which will have a great impact on his business.

Reynaldo hopes to increase his inventory of animals so that he can satisfy the different tastes and needs of his customers in the area. As a result, he will be to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, and other livestock so that he can increase his business.

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es:
El cantón del Carmen posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, en este lugar se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito El Palmar.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 24  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 1 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela. El marido es agricultor y cría ganado. Viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña Sonia es una muy  buena esposa y ama de casa que trata de ayudarle a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar y es para esto que ella realiza los créditos, para que él  utilice  en su trabajo, el se dedica a la cría de cerdos  y  aves de corral para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, ella en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o vende por libras. Los chanchos en cambio los faenan y venden la carne por libras, también venden huevos de gallina criolla, queso, y mantequilla. De esta forma ella se gana algo desde su casa para el bien de su familia.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Lleva 2 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la apoyan con la rapidez del crédito. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen has a wealth of flora and fauna. One of the main sources of income in this area is the cultivation of bananas of the Barranganete variety. The members of the Communal Bank “El Palmar” meet in this place.

It is here that one can find Sra. Sonia. She is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 6 and 1). Her older child is in school. Sonia’s husband is a farmer who raises livestock. They live at her parents’ house.

Doña Sonia is a good wife and homemaker who tries to help her husband with the major household responsibilities. For this reason, she has taken out loans that her husband can use for his work. He raises pigs and poultry on the small farm located at their house. On a seasonal basis, they buy a large quantity of chickens and raise them over a two to three month period. When the time is right, the chickens are delivered to shops in town or sold by the pound. The pigs are butchered and the meat is sold by the pound. They also sell eggs, cheese, and butter. By working in this manner, Sonia is able to earn some income from home for the benefit of her family.

This new loan will be used to buy chickens, animal feed, and medicines. Sonia has been with her Communal Bank for two years and enjoys being a member because of the help with getting loans quickly approved. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens, animal feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza is a married woman with four children. She is 33 years old and has one child in school. Niza is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Niza has a beauty products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase beauty products to sell.

Niza has been in this business for two years. In the future, Niza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to sell

loans.name: Nafaimai Group

texts.en:
Nang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. Nang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Nang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. 

The water filter Nang and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Nang is excited the purchase of the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Neuang Group

texts.en:
Meo’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Meo and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now spend on other pursuits.

The water filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Meo’s family generally identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

Meo and her group are excited that the water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al oficio doméstico y tiene dos hijos.

Roberto, ha trabajado en la agricultura desde muy joven, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en este oficio, pero además de dedicarse a la agricultura también, se dedica a la venta de pan.

Con el crédito que esta solicitando pretende comprar pliegos de lámina, para repara el techo de su vivienda, porque la lámina que tiene, está bien deteriorada.

Su mayor sueño es poder construir su casa un poco más grande y de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Roberto is 35 years old and studied through the sixth grade. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties. They have two children.

Roberto has worked in agriculture since he was a very young boy. His parents taught him this trade and now he is in the same line of work. He also sells bread. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy metal sheets for repairing the roof of his home since the existing sheets have deteriorated.

His greatest wish is to build a slightly larger house out of brick.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets for repairing the roof of his home.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
La venta de comida es el negocio que le ha generado felicidad y mejores condiciones de vida a la familia de gloria, que con sus comidas rápidas ha levantado de la pobreza a su familia y sigue proyectándose porque quiere más, sueña con tener un restaurante y ser muy feliz atendiéndolo. 
Ella es madre de 3 hijos y se preguntan porque está ahora presentándose ante ustedes?, la razón pasa porque tiene necesidades como adecuaciones del local, comprar mesas y sillas, comprar materia prima para la elaboración de perros calientes, hamburguesas, pizzas, chorizos, chuzos de pollo, chuzos de carne, carne asada. 
Con estos insumos su negocio será más atractivo, pues ahora sus clientes disfrutaran los alimentos en una cómoda silla con mesas.
Apoya a esta mujer de 50 años que un día levanto a su familia de su pobreza y que ahora persigue el sueño de tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Selling food is a business that has resulted in happiness and better living conditions for Gloria’s family. As a result of the fast food that she prepares, she has been able to lift her family out of poverty and keep them on an upward path because she wants more for them. Her dream is to have a restaurant and be happy with managing it.

Gloria is the mother of three children. She was asked why she wants to share her story with everyone. The reason is that she needs to make renovations to her shop and also buy tables, chairs, and the supplies she needs for making hot dogs, hamburgers, pizzas, chorizo sausage, chicken kebabs, beef kebabs, and roast beef.

With these supplies, her business will become more attractive. At that point, her customers can enjoy their food and be comfortable by having tables and chairs.

Support this 50-year-old woman who wakes up each day so that she can keep her family out of poverty and pursue her dream of opening a restaurant.

loans.use: to make renovations to her shop and also buy tables, chairs, and the supplies she needs for preparing fast food.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia in the Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“My name is Sultan. Sultan is the noble title of certain rulers in Arabic countries, who claimed almost full sovereignty in practical terms. The dynasty and lands ruled by a sultan are referred to as a sultanate. My name and its meaning heartens me to great achievements and allows me to hope as it’s just a dream for me, and unfortunately, my life is quite different from the life of Arabic kings.

I am a 19-year-old student who has a big desire to pursue a higher education at the American University of Central Asia. AUCA is the first serious step into my adult life and it will give me a solid base for future professional education and career development. I am getting comfortable with the fact that I will have to study throughout my whole career path. My motto is: 'Take as much knowledge as you can now, you will thank yourself for your hard work later'.

I live with my mother and younger sister, who is 15 years old. My parents are divorced and my father lives separate from us and, in fact, he doesn’t help us. The three of us live in our relative’s apartment as we don’t have our own house. My mother is 42 years old and she is a civil servant. Her wage is, on average, 590 USD per month. We don’t have a car or real estate from which we could earn a profit, so we do live within our means. My mother works hard to provide for the three of us, but it’s really hard for her to pay for our daily necessities and pay for my tuition. If I could get a Kiva loan and get a Degree at AUCA, I would become a professional with a stable future to provide for my family's well-being.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Champeswari

texts.en:
Champeswari is a 34-year-old differently able woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Balangir district, Odisha. Her children are in school. She works in a ladies tailoring shop where she get 1,500 INR per month, which is very little at this time, so she planned to open a small tailoring shop in her house so she can earn more money and give enough time to her family as well as.

Champeswari has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to buy a new tailoring machine and threads in bulk to start her tailoring shop. She hopes that now she can provide more help to her husband financially for managing the family responsibilities. She is thankful to those who are going to be a part of her dream in any way.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine and thread

loans.name: Seevilai Group

texts.en:
Thuang understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Thuang purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or forage for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Thuang is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nongping Group

texts.en:
Noy and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. Noy and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Noy and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Noy and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Noy is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonnokkhien Group

texts.en:
Nid’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Nid and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now spend on other pursuits. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Nid’s family generally identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. Nid and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pakthuangneua Group

texts.en:
Thin understands the difference that the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. She knows that water from local sources requires boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. 

The water filter that Thin purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent buying charcoal and the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The water filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Thin is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years so she and her group can continue to receive the benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so her family can have access to safe drinking water.
